card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : The ability will resolve and the creature will become tapped before blocking creatures are declared. £7/1/2013 : In a Two-Headed Giant game, any creature controlled by a member of the defending team can be chosen as the target. £7/1/2013 : In other multiplayer formats, including Commander, only a creature controlled by the defending player Master of Diversion is attacking can be chosen as the target, even if your other attacking creatures are attacking different players.

card.name: Megantic Sliver
card.ability: Sliver creatures you control get +3/+3.
card.flavor: #_Even the thrums, the lowliest of slivers, become deadly in its presence._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : If you change the creature type of a Sliver you control so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures you control. £7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.

card.name: Merfolk Spy
card.ability: Islandwalk #_(This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)_#£Whenever Merfolk Spy deals combat damage to a player, that player reveals a card at random from his or her hand.
card.ruling: £8/15/2010 : Islandwalk cares about lands with the land type Island, not necessarily lands named Island. £8/15/2010 : The second ability triggers just once each time Merfolk Spy deals combat damage to a player, regardless of how much damage it deals. £8/15/2010 : After the second ability resolves, the revealed card stops being revealed in its owner's hand. £8/15/2010 : The next time Merfolk Spy deals combat damage to the same player, the card that's revealed at random may be the same card or may be a different card.
card.name_JP: マーフォークのスパイ

card.name: Messenger Drake
card.ability: Flying£When Messenger Drake dies, draw a card.
card.flavor: #_The more important the message, the larger the messenger._#

card.name: Millstone
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: #_Minds, like mountains, are never so grand and mighty that they can't be reduced to dust._#
card.ruling: £10/4/2004 : Can be used on a player with less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available. £10/4/2004 : It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose. £10/4/2004 : Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, the affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

card.name: Mind Rot
card.ability: Target player discards two cards.
card.flavor: #_"What a pity. You should have written it down."—Liliana Vess_#

card.name: Mindsparker
card.ability: First strike #_(This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)_#£Whenever an opponent casts a white or blue instant or sorcery spell, Mindsparker deals 2 damage to that player.
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : Mindsparker’s ability will trigger whenever an opponent casts an instant or sorcery spell that’s white, blue, or both. If the spell is both white and blue, Mindsparker’s ability will trigger only once. £7/1/2013 : If an opponent casts a copy of a white or blue instant or sorcery card (as opposed to putting a copy of such a spell directly on the stack), the ability will trigger.

card.name: Minotaur Abomination
card.flavor: #_"Look at that. Shuffling, wobbling, entrails placed haphazardly. It's shameful. Who would let that kind of work flap about for all to see?"—Lestin, necromancer_#
card.name_JP: ミノタウルスの嫌悪者

card.name: Molten Birth
card.ability: Put two 1/1 red Elemental creature tokens onto the battlefield. Then flip a coin. If you win the flip, return Molten Birth to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: #_"Few can coax the creatures within the magma to be cooled and take form."—Koth of the Hammer_#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : If you win the flip, Molten Birth goes directly from the stack to its owner’s hand. It never goes to a graveyard.

card.name: Mutavault
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.£{1}: Mutavault becomes a 2/2 creature with all creature types until end of turn. It's still a land.
card.flavor: #_Some worlds possess a hidden core where life's essence constantly surges._#
card.ruling: £4/1/2008 : Although Mutavault has all creature types while it's animated, it does not have the changeling keyword ability. £8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature. £7/1/2013 : Examples of creature types include Sliver, Goblin, and Soldier. Creature types appear after the dash on the type line of creatures.

card.name: Naturalize
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: #_"When your cities and trinkets crumble, only nature will remain."—Garruk Wildspeaker_#

card.name: Negate
card.ability: Counter target noncreature spell.
card.flavor: #_Masters of the arcane savor a delicious irony. Their study of deep and complex arcana leads to such a simple end: the ability to say merely yes or no._#
card.ruling: £10/1/2009 : A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

card.name: Nephalia Seakite
card.ability: Flash #_(You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)_#£Flying
card.flavor: #_"Keep one eye on the cliff road or you may fall to your death. Keep one eye on the sky or your death may fall on you."—Manfried Ulmach, Elgaud Master-at-Arms_#

card.name: Nightmare
card.ability: Flying£Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
card.flavor: #_The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair._#
card.ruling: £4/1/2008 : If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority. £10/1/2009 : Nightmare's power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes. £7/1/2013 : The ability that defines Nightmare’s power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield. £7/1/2013 : Nightmare’s ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

card.name: Nightwing Shade
card.ability: Flying£{1}{B}: Nightwing Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"There is one hour of the night even we do not watch."—Sedva, captain of the watch_#

card.name: Oath of the Ancient Wood
card.ability: Whenever Oath of the Ancient Wood or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, you may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
card.flavor: #_"Some gaze upon the forest and see trees. I see true power."_#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : If the enchantment that enters the battlefield is somehow also a creature, you may choose it as the target of Oath of the Ancient Wood’s ability.

card.name: Ogre Battledriver
card.ability: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, that creature gets +2/+0 and gains haste until end of turn. #_(It can attack and {T} this turn.)_#
card.flavor: #_Ogres are driven by passion, rage, and another ogre standing behind them with a whip._#

card.name: Opportunity
card.ability: Target player draws four cards.
card.flavor: #_"Opportunity isn't something you wait for. It's something you create."_#

card.name: Pacifism
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
card.flavor: #_For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside._#

card.name: Path of Bravery
card.ability: As long as your life total is greater than or equal to your starting life total, creatures you control get +1/+1.£Whenever one or more creatures you control attack, you gain life equal to the number of attacking creatures.
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : Your starting life total is the life total you began the game with, keeping in mind the format you’re playing and, in some rare cases, anything that affects your starting life total (for example, a vanguard with a life modifier). £7/1/2013 : In most games, your starting life total is 20. In a Commander game, your starting life total is 40 instead. In a Two-Headed Giant game, Path of Bravery compares your team’s life total to your team’s starting life total, which is 30. £7/1/2013 : Path of Bravery’s triggered ability triggers only once, after attacking creatures are declared. For example, if you attack with five creatures, you’ll gain 5 life as a single life-gain event. £7/1/2013 : If a creature enters the battlefield attacking after attacking creatures have been declared, the ability won’t trigger again because you didn’t declare that creature as an attacking creature. However, if enters the battlefield before the ability resolves, it will be counted when determining how much life is gained.

card.name: Pay No Heed
card.ability: Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.
card.flavor: #_"Out of this nettle, danger, we pluck this flower, safety."—William Shakespeare, King Henry IV, Part I_#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : Pay No Heed doesn’t target anything. You can choose a source with hexproof, for example. You choose the damage source as Pay No Heed resolves. £7/1/2013 : If the chosen source is a permanent spell, damage dealt later in the turn by the permanent it becomes will also be prevented.

card.name: Phantom Warrior
card.ability: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
card.flavor: #_"The construction of a defense is not accomplished by adding bricks."—Jace Beleren_#

card.name: Pillarfield Ox
card.flavor: #_"You old, immobile clod! If I could stuff your doltish head with knowledge, I'd do it just so someone else could fully comprehend what your stubbornness has cost me!"—Bruse Tarl, Goma Fada nomad_#

card.name: Pitchburn Devils
card.ability: When Pitchburn Devils dies, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: #_The ingenuity of goblins, the depravity of demons, and the smarts of sheep._#

card.name: Planar Cleansing
card.ability: Destroy all nonland permanents.

card.name: Plummet
card.ability: Destroy target creature with flying.
card.flavor: #_"Let nothing own the skies but the wind."—Dejara, Giltwood druid_#

card.name: Predatory Sliver
card.ability: Sliver creatures you control get +1/+1.
card.flavor: #_No matter how much the slivers change, their collective might remains._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : If you change the creature type of a Sliver you control so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures you control. £7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.

card.name: Primeval Bounty
card.ability: Whenever you cast a creature spell, put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.£Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, put three +1/+1 counters on target creature you control.£Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 3 life.
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : The last ability triggers whenever you play a land and also whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control for some other reason, such as the ability of Into the Wilds.

card.name: Pyromancer's Gauntlet
card.ability: If a red instant or sorcery spell you control or a red planeswalker you control would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals that much damage plus 2 to that permanent or player instead.
card.flavor: #_An inferno is just a gesture away._#

card.name: Quag Sickness
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 for each Swamp you control.
card.flavor: #_The dread gases didn't kill Farbid. But as he lay in the muck, miserable and helpless, watching ghouls and rats advance on him, he wished they had._#
card.ruling: £8/15/2010 : This ability counts the number of Swamps controlled by Quag Sickness's controller, not the enchanted creature's controller (in case they're different players). £8/15/2010 : This bonus is not fixed; it changes as the number of Swamps you control changes. £8/15/2010 : The ability cares about lands with the land type Swamp, not necessarily lands named Swamp.

card.name: Quicken
card.ability: The next sorcery card you cast this turn can be cast as though it had flash. #_(It can be cast any time you could cast an instant.)_#£Draw a card.
card.flavor: #_A skilled Izzet chronarch can carry out an epic vendetta between the fall of one hourglass grain and the next._#
card.ruling: £2/1/2006 : You don't choose a sorcery card when Quicken resolves. Rather, this sets up a rule that is true for you until the turn ends or until you cast a sorcery card, even if you cast that sorcery at a time you normally could. £2/1/2006 : If you cast multiple Quickens on the same turn, they'll all apply to the very next sorcery spell you cast. £9/25/2006 : After Quicken resolves, you can Suspend a Sorcery in your hand any time you can cast an Instant. As soon as you actually cast a Sorcery, you lose this capability. £7/1/2013 : Casting a copy of a sorcery card won’t “use up” Quicken’s effect because the copy isn’t a card.

card.name: Ranger's Guile
card.ability: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains hexproof until end of turn. #_(It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)_#
card.flavor: #_"You don't survive in the wild by standing in plain sight."—Garruk Wildspeaker_#
card.name_JP: レインジャーの悪知恵

card.name: Ratchet Bomb
card.ability: {T}: Put a charge counter on Ratchet Bomb.£{T}, Sacrifice Ratchet Bomb: Destroy each nonland permanent with converted mana cost equal to the number of charge counters on Ratchet Bomb.
card.ruling: £1/1/2011 : As Ratchet Bomb's last ability resolves, its last existence on the battlefield is checked to determine how many charge counters were on it. £1/1/2011 : Ratchet Bomb's second ability destroys only those nonland permanents whose converted mana cost is exactly equal to the number of charge counters on Ratchet Bomb. It doesn't matter who controls them. £1/1/2011 : If Ratchet Bomb's second ability is activated while it has no charge counters on it, it will destroy each nonland permanent with converted mana cost 0. £1/1/2011 : The converted mana cost of a permanent is determined solely by the mana symbols printed in its upper right corner, unless it's copying something else (see below). The converted mana cost is the total amount of mana in that cost, regardless of color. For example, a card with mana cost {3}{U}{U} has converted mana cost 5. £1/1/2011 : If a permanent is copying something else, its converted mana cost is the converted mana cost of whatever it's copying. £1/1/2011 : In all cases, ignore any alternative costs or additional costs (such as kicker) paid when the permanent was cast. £1/1/2011 : If the mana cost of a permanent includes {X}, X is considered to be 0. £1/1/2011 : If a nonland permanent has no mana symbols in its upper right corner (because it's a token that's not copying something else, for example), its converted mana cost is 0.

card.name: Regathan Firecat
card.flavor: #_It stalks the Regathan highlands, leaving behind melted snow, scorched earth, and the charred corpses of would-be temple robbers._#

card.name: Ring of Three Wishes
card.ability: Ring of Three Wishes enters the battlefield with three wish counters on it.£{5}, {T}, Remove a wish counter from Ring of Three Wishes: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

card.name: Rise of the Dark Realms
card.ability: Put all creature cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control.
card.flavor: #_"For every living person there are generations of dead. Which realm would you rather rule?"—Liliana Vess_#

card.name: Rod of Ruin
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: #_The good news is it's so simple a goblin could use it. The bad news is it's so simple a goblin could use it._#

card.name: Rootwalla
card.ability: {1}{G}: Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: #_They make terrible pets . . . unless you don't like your other pets._#
card.ruling: £2/1/2006 : If this card's ability is activated by one player, then another player takes control of it on the same turn, the second player can't activate its ability that turn.

card.name: Rumbling Baloth
card.flavor: #_In the dim light beneath the vast trees of Deepglade, baloths prowl in search of prey. Their guttural calls are more felt than heard, but their attack scream carries for miles._#

card.name: Sanguine Bond
card.ability: Whenever you gain life, target opponent loses that much life.
card.flavor: #_"Blood is constant. Every drop I drink, someone must bleed."—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus_#
card.ruling: £10/1/2009 : Sanguine Bond's ability triggers just once for each life-gaining event, whether it's 1 life from Soul Warden or 8 life from Tendrils of Corruption.

card.name: Savage Summoning
card.ability: Savage Summoning can't be countered.£The next creature card you cast this turn can be cast as though it had flash. That spell can't be countered. That creature enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : You don’t choose a creature card when Savage Summoning resolves. Rather, it applies to the next creature card you cast that turn, even if you cast it at a time when you normally could cast a creature and even if you cast it from a zone other than your hand. £7/1/2013 : If you cast multiple Savage Summonings in succession, they’ll apply to the next creature spell you cast. That creature will enter the battlefield with that many additional +1/+1 counters on it. £7/1/2013 : Spells that would counter Savage Summoning or the relevant creature spell can still be cast. They won’t counter the spell, but any additional effects they have will happen.

card.name: Scavenging Ooze
card.ability: {G}: Exile target card from a graveyard. If it was a creature card, put a +1/+1 counter on Scavenging Ooze and you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: #_In nature, not a single bone or scrap of flesh goes to waste._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : If the target card is an illegal target when the ability tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. No counter will be put on Scavenging Ooze and you won’t gain life.

card.name: Scourge of Valkas
card.ability: Flying£Whenever Scourge of Valkas or another Dragon enters the battlefield under your control, it deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of Dragons you control.£{R}: Scourge of Valkas gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : The amount of damage dealt by the Dragon that entered the battlefield is based on the number of Dragons you control when the ability resolves.

card.name: Scroll Thief
card.ability: Whenever Scroll Thief deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.
card.flavor: #_Kapsho merfolk have infiltrated fortresses as remote as the desert citadel in Sunari in their relentless quest for arcane knowledge._#
card.ruling: £8/15/2010 : The ability triggers just once each time Scroll Thief deals combat damage to a player, regardless of how much damage it deals. £8/15/2010 : The ability is mandatory. You must draw a card when it resolves.

card.name: Seacoast Drake
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: #_Seacoast drakes have been known to follow ships for hundreds of miles, waiting to snap up garbage, bait, and the occasional sailor._#

card.name: Seismic Stomp
card.ability: Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
card.flavor: #_"It is not in me to tread lightly."—Ryda, geomancer_#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : No creature without flying will be able to block that turn, including creatures that lose flying after Seismic Stomp resolves and creatures without flying that enter the battlefield after Seismic Stomp resolves.

card.name: Sengir Vampire
card.ability: Flying£Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
card.flavor: #_Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal._#
card.ruling: £7/15/2007 : If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter. £9/22/2011 : Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into. £9/22/2011 : If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

card.name: Sensory Deprivation
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature gets -3/-0.
card.flavor: #_They call it "stitcher's anesthesia," a spell to deaden the senses while the mad doctors begin their grisly work._#

card.name: Sentinel Sliver
card.ability: Sliver creatures you control have vigilance. #_(Attacking doesn't cause them to tap.)_#
card.flavor: #_Through its watchful gaze, all slivers may see._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : If you change the creature type of a Sliver you control so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures you control. £7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.

card.name: Seraph of the Sword
card.ability: Flying£Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to Seraph of the Sword.
card.flavor: #_"Only when my sword lies idle shall I rejoice."_#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : If Seraph of the Sword blocks a creature with trample, that creature’s controller must assign 3 damage to Seraph of the Sword (assuming it’s blocking no other creatures, there was no damage marked on it, and nothing has changed its toughness). The remainder can be assigned to the defending player or planeswalker.

card.name: Serra Angel
card.ability: Flying£Vigilance #_(Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)_#
card.flavor: #_Follow the light. In its absence, follow her._#

card.name: Shadowborn Apostle
card.ability: A deck can have any number of cards named Shadowborn Apostle.£{B}, Sacrifice six creatures named Shadowborn Apostle: Search your library for a Demon creature card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : Shadowborn Apostle’s first ability lets you ignore only the “four-of” rule. It doesn’t let you ignore format legality. £7/1/2013 : You sacrifice the six creatures when you activate the ability. You can’t respond to that ability by activating the ability of one of the other Shadowborn Apostles you just sacrificed. £7/1/2013 : You don’t have to sacrifice the Shadowborn Apostle whose ability you activated. It can be six other Shadowborn Apostles.

card.name: Shadowborn Demon
card.ability: Flying£When Shadowborn Demon enters the battlefield, destroy target non-Demon creature.£At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are fewer than six creature cards in your graveyard, sacrifice a creature.
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : Shadowborn Demon’s enters-the-battlefield ability is mandatory. If you control the only non-Demon creature, you must choose it as the target. £7/1/2013 : The last ability checks whether you have fewer than six creature cards in your graveyard when it would trigger. If you have six or more, it won’t trigger at all. The ability will check again when it tries to resolve. If at that time you have six or more, the ability won’t do anything.

card.name: Shimmering Grotto
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.£{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: #_Untold riches await those who forsake the bustling world to search the secret, silent places._#

card.name: Shivan Dragon
card.ability: Flying£{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv._#

card.name: Shiv's Embrace
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.£{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_When you see the world as a dragon sees it, everything looks fit to burn._#
card.ruling: £8/15/2010 : Only Shiv's Embrace's controller (who is not necessarily the enchanted creature's controller) can activate its activated ability. £8/15/2010 : When Shiv's Embrace's activated ability resolves, the creature Shiv's Embrace is enchanting at that time will get +1/+0 (regardless of what creature Shiv's Embrace was enchanting when the ability was activated). If Shiv's Embrace has left the battlefield by then, the creature it was enchanting at the time it left the battlefield will get +1/+0.

card.name: Shock
card.ability: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Show of Valor
card.ability: Target creature gets +2/+4 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_Cowards watch. Heroes act._#

card.name: Shrivel
card.ability: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"Do not weep for the frail. Their time couldn't have been that far off."—Nathrac, plaguesower_#
card.ruling: £6/15/2010 : Only creatures on the battlefield as Shrivel resolves are affected.

card.name: Siege Mastodon
card.flavor: #_"The walls of the wicked will fall before us. Ready the siege engines. We proceed to war!"—General Avitora_#

card.name: Silence
card.ability: Your opponents can't cast spells this turn. #_(Spells cast before this resolves are unaffected.)_#
card.flavor: #_"Take a quiet moment to reflect on your sins."—Cleph, Order of Redeemed Souls_#
card.ruling: £10/1/2009 : Silence won't affect spells that your opponents cast before you cast Silence. (In other words, it can't be used as a retroactive Cancel.) Silence also won't stop your opponents from casting spells after you cast Silence but before Silence resolves. £10/1/2009 : The only thing Silence does is prevent your opponents from casting spells. They can still activate abilities, including abilities of cards in their hands (like cycling). Their triggered abilities work as normal, they can still play lands, and so on.

card.name: Sliver Construct
card.flavor: #_Slivers destroy those who come close to the Skep, the central hive. Shards of torn metal litter the ground as a warning to any artificers inquisitive about the hive's inner workings._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : If you change the creature type of a Sliver you control so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures you control. £7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.

card.name: Smelt
card.ability: Destroy target artifact.
card.flavor: #_"Looks like that wasn't darksteel after all."—Koth of the Hammer_#

card.name: Solemn Offering
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 4 life.
card.flavor: #_"You will be reimbursed for your donation.""The reimbursement is spiritual."—Temple signs_#
card.ruling: £10/1/2009 : If the targeted permanent is an illegal target by the time Solemn Offering would resolve, the entire spell is countered. You won't gain any life.

card.name: Soulmender
card.ability: {T}: You gain 1 life.
card.flavor: #_"Healing is more art than magic. Well, there is still quite a bit of magic."_#

card.name: Spell Blast
card.ability: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X. #_(For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)_#
card.flavor: #_"Perhaps you could try throwing a rock? That might be better suited to your intellect."_#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : Alternative costs, additional costs, cost increases, and cost reductions don’t affect a spell’s converted mana cost. £7/1/2013 : If the target spell has {X} in its converted mana cost, include the value chosen for that X when determining the value of the {X} in Spell Blast’s mana cost. For example, if you wish to counter Volcanic Geyser (a spell with mana cost {X}{R}{R}) whose X is 7, you’ll need to choose 9 for Spell Blast’s X and pay {9}{U}.

card.name: Sporemound
card.ability: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: #_"If you threaten its territory, it produces spores. Actually, no matter what you do, it produces spores."—Hadi Kasten, Calla Dale naturalist_#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : Sporemound’s ability triggers whenever you play a land and also whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control for some other reason, such as the ability of Into the Wilds.

card.name: Staff of the Death Magus
card.ability: Whenever you cast a black spell or a Swamp enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: #_A symbol of ambition in ruthless times._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : The ability will trigger on any land with the appropriate land type entering the battlefield, including non-basic lands of that type £7/1/2013 : Many nonbasic lands don’t have basic land types, even if they produce colored mana. Such a land entering the battlefield will not trigger this card's ability. £7/1/2013 : If you cast a copy of a card that's the appropriate color, the ability will trigger. However, if you simply copy a spell on the stack that's the appropriate color the ability will not trigger.

card.name: Staff of the Flame Magus
card.ability: Whenever you cast a red spell or a Mountain enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: #_A symbol of passion in indifferent times._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : The ability will trigger on any land with the appropriate land type entering the battlefield, including non-basic lands of that type £7/1/2013 : Many nonbasic lands don’t have basic land types, even if they produce colored mana. Such a land entering the battlefield will not trigger this card's ability. £7/1/2013 : If you cast a copy of a card that's the appropriate color, the ability will trigger. However, if you simply copy a spell on the stack that's the appropriate color the ability will not trigger.

card.name: Staff of the Mind Magus
card.ability: Whenever you cast a blue spell or an Island enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: #_A symbol of sagacity in bewildering times._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : The ability will trigger on any land with the appropriate land type entering the battlefield, including non-basic lands of that type £7/1/2013 : Many nonbasic lands don’t have basic land types, even if they produce colored mana. Such a land entering the battlefield will not trigger this card's ability. £7/1/2013 : If you cast a copy of a card that's the appropriate color, the ability will trigger. However, if you simply copy a spell on the stack that's the appropriate color the ability will not trigger.

card.name: Staff of the Sun Magus
card.ability: Whenever you cast a white spell or a Plains enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: #_A symbol of conviction in uncertain times._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : The ability will trigger on any land with the appropriate land type entering the battlefield, including non-basic lands of that type £7/1/2013 : Many nonbasic lands don’t have basic land types, even if they produce colored mana. Such a land entering the battlefield will not trigger this card's ability. £7/1/2013 : If you cast a copy of a card that's the appropriate color, the ability will trigger. However, if you simply copy a spell on the stack that's the appropriate color the ability will not trigger.

card.name: Staff of the Wild Magus
card.ability: Whenever you cast a green spell or a Forest enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: #_A symbol of ferocity in oppressive times._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : The ability will trigger on any land with the appropriate land type entering the battlefield, including non-basic lands of that type £7/1/2013 : Many nonbasic lands don’t have basic land types, even if they produce colored mana. Such a land entering the battlefield will not trigger this card's ability. £7/1/2013 : If you cast a copy of a card that's the appropriate color, the ability will trigger. However, if you simply copy a spell on the stack that's the appropriate color the ability will not trigger.

card.name: Steelform Sliver
card.ability: Sliver creatures you control get +0/+1.
card.flavor: #_"Though the slivers may sometimes resemble us, they are not human. Anyone who fights them must remember this."—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge_#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : If you change the creature type of a Sliver you control so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures you control. £7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.

card.name: Stonehorn Chanter
card.ability: {5}{W}: Stonehorn Chanter gains vigilance and lifelink until end of turn. #_(Attacking doesn't cause it to tap. Damage dealt by it also causes you to gain that much life.)_#
card.flavor: #_With the Stonehorn, piety and power are one._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : Multiple instances of vigilance and lifelink are redundant. There’s usually no reason to activate Stonehorn Chanter’s ability more than once in a single turn.

card.name: Striking Sliver
card.ability: Sliver creatures you control have first strike. #_(They deal combat damage before creatures without first strike.)_#
card.flavor: #_You're too busy recoiling in fear to realize that it's already hit you._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : If Striking Sliver leaves the battlefield after Sliver creatures you control have dealt first-strike damage but before regular combat damage, those Slivers won’t deal regular combat damage (unless they have double strike for some reason). £7/1/2013 : If you change the creature type of a Sliver you control so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures you control. £7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.

card.name: Strionic Resonator
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Copy target triggered ability you control. You may choose new targets for the copy. #_(A triggered ability uses the words "when," "whenever," or "at.")_#
card.flavor: #_Its tines cannot be rung by mere physical force. Only magic of great power can start its eldritch resonance._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : Strionic Resonator targets a triggered ability that has triggered and is on the stack. £7/1/2013 : The source of the copy is the same as the source of the original ability. £7/1/2013 : If the triggered ability is modal (that is, if it says “Choose one —” or similar), the mode is copied and can’t be changed. £7/1/2013 : If the triggered ability divides damage or distributes counters among a number of targets (for example, the ability of Bogardan Hellkite), the division and number of targets can’t be changed. If you choose new targets, you must choose the same number of targets. £7/1/2013 : Any choices made when the triggered ability resolves won’t have been made yet when it’s copied. Any such choices will be made separately when the copy resolves. If the triggered ability asks you to pay a cost (for example, as the extort ability from the Return to Ravnica block does), you pay that cost for the copy. £7/1/2013 : If a triggered ability is linked to a second ability, copies of that triggered ability are also linked to that second ability. If the second ability refers to “the exiled card,” it refers to all cards exiled by the triggered ability and the copy. For example, if Exclusion Ritual’s enters-the-battlefield ability is copied and two nonland permanents are exiled, players can’t cast spells with the same name as either exiled card. £7/1/2013 : In some cases involving linked abilities, an ability requires information about “the exiled card.” When this happens, the ability gets multiple answers. If these answers are being used to determine the value of a variable, the sum is used. For example, if Elite Arcanist’s enters-the-battlefield ability is copied, two cards are exiled. The value of X in the activation cost of Elite Arcanist’s other ability is the sum of the two cards’ converted mana costs. As the ability resolves, you create copies of both cards and can cast none, one, or both of the copies in any order.

card.name: Suntail Hawk
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: #_"They are the finest companions in the realm. Swift, clever, and easily trained to hunt intruders."—Almira, falconer_#

card.name: Syphon Sliver
card.ability: Sliver creatures you control have lifelink. #_(Damage dealt by a Sliver creature you control also causes you to gain that much life.)_#
card.flavor: #_When the hive must feed, every appendage becomes an additional mouth._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : If you change the creature type of a Sliver you control so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures you control. £7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.

card.name: Tenacious Dead
card.ability: When Tenacious Dead dies, you may pay {1}{B}. If you do, return it to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control.
card.flavor: #_Raising the bones of Hekjek the Mad proved far easier than getting them to lie back down._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : You decide whether to pay {1}{B} when the ability resolves. If you choose not to, you won’t get another chance later. £7/1/2013 : If you control a Tenacious Dead owned by another player when it dies, you’ll control the triggered ability. However, if you choose to pay {1}{B}, it will be put onto the battlefield under its owner’s control.

card.name: Thorncaster Sliver
card.ability: Sliver creatures you control have "Whenever this creature attacks, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
card.flavor: #_Every inch of a sliver's body is a potential claw, appendage, or projectile._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : If you control multiple Thorncaster Slivers and a Sliver you control attacks, each ability will trigger separately. £7/1/2013 : If you change the creature type of a Sliver you control so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures you control. £7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.

card.name: Thunder Strike
card.ability: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. #_(It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)_#
card.flavor: #_Lightning reflexes, thunderous might._#
card.ruling: £8/15/2010 : Thunder Strike can target any creature, even one that already has first strike or double strike. (If it affects such a creature, it will, in effect, just give it +2/+0.) £8/15/2010 : If a creature doesn't have first strike, granting it first strike after combat damage has been dealt in the first-strike combat damage step won't prevent it from dealing combat damage. It will still assign and deal its combat damage in the second combat damage step.

card.name: Tidebinder Mage
card.ability: When Tidebinder Mage enters the battlefield, tap target red or green creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as you control Tidebinder Mage.
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : If you lose control of Tidebinder Mage between when it entered the battlefield and when the ability resolves, the target creature will become tapped. However, it won’t be affected by the other effect and will untap as normal during its controller’s untap step. £7/1/2013 : If another player gains control of Tidebinder Mage, the creature will no longer be affected by the ability preventing it from untapping, even if you later regain control of Tidebinder Mage. £7/1/2013 : If you gain control of the creature that’s being prevented from untapping, that creature won’t untap during your untap step for as long as you control Tidebinder Mage. £7/1/2013 : The ability can target a tapped creature. If the targeted creature is already tapped when it resolves, that creature just remains tapped and doesn’t untap during its controller’s next untap step.

card.name: Time Ebb
card.ability: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
card.flavor: #_"Yesterday you were just a figment of your master's imagination. I liked you better then."—Shai Fusan, archmage_#

card.name: Tome Scour
card.ability: Target player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: #_"I hope none of those were important!"_#
card.ruling: £10/1/2009 : If there are fewer than five cards in the targeted player's library, that player puts all the cards from his or her library into his or her graveyard.

card.name: Trading Post
card.ability: {1}, {T}, Discard a card: You gain 4 life.£{1}, {T}, Pay 1 life: Put a 0/1 white Goat creature token onto the battlefield.£{1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.£{1}, {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Draw a card.

card.name: Trained Condor
card.ability: Flying£Whenever Trained Condor attacks, another target creature you control gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"They're smart enough to understand that war means lots of carrion."—Griv, condor rider_#

card.name: Traumatize
card.ability: Target player puts the top half of his or her library, rounded down, into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: #_He was left with just enough memory to understand what he had lost._#
card.ruling: £10/4/2004 : The player can put the cards in their graveyard in any order they choose.

card.name: Trollhide
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has "{1}{G}: Regenerate this creature." #_(The next time the creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)_#
card.ruling: £9/22/2011 : Activating the ability granted to the enchanted creature causes a "regeneration shield" to be created for it. The next time that creature would be destroyed that turn, the regeneration shield is used up instead. This works only if the creature is dealt lethal damage, dealt damage from a source with deathtouch, or affected by a spell or ability that says to "destroy" it. Other effects that cause the creature to be put into the graveyard (such as reducing its toughness to 0 or sacrificing it) don't destroy it, so regeneration won't save it. If it hasn't been used, the regeneration shield goes away as the turn ends. £9/22/2011 : To work, the regeneration shield must be created before the enchanted creature is destroyed. This usually means activating its ability during the declare blockers step, or in response to a spell or ability that would destroy it. £9/22/2011 : If the enchanted creature is dealt lethal damage and is dealt damage by a source with deathtouch during the same combat damage step, a single regeneration shield will save it. £7/1/2013 : Trollhide needs to be attached to the creature as the ability that creates the regeneration shield is activated, but after that, the regeneration shield will be created and remain in effect even if Trollhide is no longer attached to the creature.

card.name: Undead Minotaur
card.flavor: #_"The work that went into creating this magnificent specimen. Horrific, deadly, well-balanced. Not all necromancers do elegant work like this."—Lestin, necromancer_#
card.name_JP: アンデッドのミノタウルス

card.name: Vampire Warlord
card.ability: Sacrifice another creature: Regenerate Vampire Warlord. #_(The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)_#
card.flavor: #_"How can you serve me? By dying."_#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : Activating Vampire Warlord’s ability causes a “regeneration shield” to be created for it. The next time that creature would be destroyed that turn, the regeneration shield is used up instead. This works only if the creature is dealt lethal damage, dealt damage from a source with deathtouch, or affected by a spell or ability that says to “destroy” it. Other effects that cause the creature to be put into the graveyard (such as reducing its toughness to 0 or sacrificing it) don’t destroy it, so regeneration won’t save it. If the regeneration shield isn’t used, it goes away as the turn ends. £7/1/2013 : To work, the regeneration shield must be created before Vampire Warlord is destroyed. This usually means activating its ability during the declare blockers step, or in response to a spell or ability that would destroy it. £7/1/2013 : If Vampire Warlord is dealt lethal damage and is dealt damage by a source with deathtouch during the same combat damage step, a single regeneration shield will save it.

card.name: Vastwood Hydra
card.ability: Vastwood Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.£When Vastwood Hydra dies, you may distribute a number of +1/+1 counters equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on Vastwood Hydra among any number of creatures you control.
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : The ability that triggers when Vastwood Hydra dies doesn’t target any of the creatures. You can choose to put counters on a creature with protection from green, for example. £7/1/2013 : You choose how the counters will be distributed when the ability resolves. £7/1/2013 : In some unusual cases, Vastwood Hydra will have enough -1/-1 counters put on it to make its toughness 0 or less. If this happens, the ability will still distribute a number of +1/+1 counters equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on Vastwood Hydra before the -1/-1 counters were put on it. For example, if Vastwood Hydra has two +1/+1 counters on it and three -1/-1 counters are put on it, two +1/+1 counters will be distributed.

card.name: Verdant Haven
card.ability: Enchant land£When Verdant Haven enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.£Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool #_(in addition to the mana the land produces)_#.
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : If the land targeted by Verdant Haven is illegal as Verdant Haven tries to resolve, it will be countered and won’t enter the battlefield. Its ability that causes you to gain 2 life won’t trigger.

card.name: Vial of Poison
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice Vial of Poison: Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn. #_(Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)_#
card.flavor: #_There are worse ways to die, but not many._#

card.name: Vile Rebirth
card.ability: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: #_Grave robbers digging down cautiously listen for anything digging up._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2012 : If the creature card is an illegal target when Vile Rebirth tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't put a Zombie token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Volcanic Geyser
card.ability: Volcanic Geyser deals X damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: #_"The common folk call it the breaking of the crust or the spilling of fire. Geomancers call it target practice."—Ryda, geomancer_#

card.name: Voracious Wurm
card.ability: Voracious Wurm enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the amount of life you've gained this turn.
card.flavor: #_Shepherds in Kalonia know it's better to let sheep roam than have them be trapped when the wurms are feeding._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : Voracious Wurm’s ability checks how much life you’ve gained during the turn, not what your life total is compared to what it was when the turn began. For example, if you start the turn at 10 life, gain 6 life during the turn, then lose 6 life later that turn, Voracious Wurm will enter the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters. £7/1/2013 : In a Two-Headed Giant game, life gained by your teammate isn’t considered, even though it causes your team’s life total to increase.

card.name: Wall of Frost
card.ability: Defender #_(This creature can't attack.)_#£Whenever Wall of Frost blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
card.flavor: #_"I have seen countless petty warmongers gaze on it for a time before turning away."—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge_#
card.ruling: £10/1/2009 : Unlike Sleep, Wall of Frost's triggered ability tracks the creature, but not its controller. If the creature changes controllers before its first controller's next untap step has come around, then it won't untap during its new controller's next untap step.

card.name: Wall of Swords
card.ability: Defender #_(This creature can't attack)_#£Flying
card.flavor: #_"When I said we needed more swords to protect the realm, this was not quite what I had in mind."—Olander, tactician of the Northern Verge_#

card.name: Warden of Evos Isle
card.ability: Flying£Creature spells with flying you cast cost {1} less to cast.
card.flavor: #_On Evos Isle, the swift and formidable aven enforce the will of the ruling sphinxes._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : A creature spell that doesn’t have flying won’t cost less even if the creature it will become would have flying once on the battlefield. For example, if you control Galerider Sliver, other Sliver spells won’t cost {1} less even though those Slivers will have flying once they’re on the battlefield. £7/1/2013 : The ability can’t reduce the colored mana requirement of a creature spell with flying.

card.name: Water Servant
card.ability: {U}: Water Servant gets +1/-1 until end of turn.£{U}: Water Servant gets -1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"This creature has innate perceptiveness. It knows when to rise and when to vanish into the tides."—Jestus Dreya, Of Elements and Eternity_#
card.ruling: £8/15/2010 : You can activate Water Servant's second ability even if doing so would cause Water Servant's power to be less than 0. If Water Servant's power is less than 0, treat it as 0 for all purposes except for further modifying it, or causing the power of another creature (such as Riptide Mangler) to become equal to it.

card.name: Wild Guess
card.ability: As an additional cost to cast Wild Guess, discard a card.£Draw two cards.
card.flavor: #_No guts, no glory._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2012 : Because discarding a card is an additional cost, you can't cast Wild Guess if you have no other cards in hand.

card.name: Wild Ricochet
card.ability: You may choose new targets for target instant or sorcery spell. Then copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
card.flavor: #_"May your day never match your expectations."—Scriptus Fleen, flectomancer_#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : Wild Ricochet can target (and copy) any instant or sorcery spell, not just one with targets. It doesn’t matter who controls it. £7/1/2013 : When Wild Ricochet resolves, it creates a copy of a spell. You control the copy. The controller of the original spell retains control of that spell. The copy is created on the stack, so it’s not “cast.” Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won’t trigger. The copy will then resolve like a normal spell, after players get a chance to cast spells and activate abilities. The copy resolves before the original spell. £7/1/2013 : The copy will have the same targets as the spell it’s copying unless you choose new ones. You may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, you can’t choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal). £7/1/2013 : If the spell Wild Ricochet copies is modal (that is, it says “Choose one —” or the like), the copy will have the same mode. You can’t choose a different one. £7/1/2013 : If the spell Wild Ricochet copies has an X whose value was determined as it was cast (like Volcanic Geyser does), the copy has the same value of X. £7/1/2013 : You can’t choose to pay any additional costs for the copy. However, effects based on any additional costs that were paid for the original spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy too. For example, if a player sacrifices a 3/3 creature to cast Fling, and you copy it with Wild Ricochet, the copy of Fling will also deal 3 damage to its target. £7/1/2013 : If the copy says that it affects “you,” it affects the controller of the copy, not the controller of the original spell. Similarly, if the copy says that it affects an “opponent,” it affects an opponent of the copy’s controller, not an opponent of the original spell’s controller.

card.name: Windreader Sphinx
card.ability: Flying£Whenever a creature with flying attacks, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: #_"Your mind is too filled with foolish concerns to hear the subtle whispers that the breeze brings."_#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : It doesn’t matter who controls the creature with flying or what player or planeswalker that creature is attacking. £7/1/2013 : Windreader Sphinx’s ability will trigger when it itself attacks. £7/1/2013 : The creature must have flying when declared as an attacking creature in order for Windreader Sphinx’s ability to trigger. For example, attacking with Trained Condor (a creature with flying and “Whenever Trained Condor attacks, another target creature you control gains flying until end of turn.”) and a creature without flying will cause the ability to trigger only once.
card.name_JP: 風読みのスフィンクス

card.name: Windstorm
card.ability: Windstorm deals X damage to each creature with flying.
card.flavor: #_"We don't like interlopers and thieves cluttering our skies."—Dionus, elvish archdruid_#

card.name: Witchstalker
card.ability: Hexproof #_(This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)_#£Whenever an opponent casts a blue or black spell during your turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Witchstalker.
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : The counter will be put on Witchstalker before the spell cast by an opponent resolves. £7/1/2013 : If an opponent casts a copy of a card that’s blue or black during your turn (as opposed to putting a copy of such a spell directly on the stack), the ability will also trigger. Check for the word “cast” in the effect that creates the copy.

card.name: Woodborn Behemoth
card.ability: As long as you control eight or more lands, Woodborn Behemoth gets +4/+4 and has trample. #_(If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)_#

card.name: Wring Flesh
card.ability: Target creature gets -3/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"You shouldn't be so attached to something as fragile as flesh."—Zul Ashur, lich lord_#

card.name: Xathrid Necromancer
card.ability: Whenever Xathrid Necromancer or another Human creature you control dies, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield tapped.
card.flavor: #_"My commands shall echo forever in their dusty skulls."_#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : If Xathrid Necromancer dies at the same time as another Human creature you control, its ability will trigger twice.

card.name: Young Pyromancer
card.ability: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, put a 1/1 red Elemental creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: #_Immolation is the sincerest form of flattery._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : You’ll put the Elemental token onto the battlefield before the instant or sorcery spell you cast resolves but after any targets of that spell are chosen.

card.name: Zephyr Charge
card.ability: {1}{U}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"All armies prefer high ground to low and sunny places to dark."—Sun Tzu, Art of War, trans. Giles_#

card.name: Abundant Growth
card.ability: Enchant land£When Abundant Growth enters the battlefield, draw a card.£Enchanted land has "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The land retains any other abilities it has.

card.name: Aggravate
card.ability: Aggravate deals 1 damage to each creature target player controls. Each creature dealt damage this way attacks this turn if able.
card.flavor: #_"Barbarians! They burned my favorite chair! We'll kill them all!"_#£#_—Anje Falkenrath_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Aggravate targets only the player. Creatures with hexproof that player controls will be dealt damage by Aggravate if it resolves. £5/1/2012 : The controller of a creature dealt damage by Aggravate still decides which player or planeswalker the creature attacks. £5/1/2012 : If, during a player's declare attackers step, a creature is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or hasn't been under that player's control continuously since the turn began (and doesn't have haste), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having a creature attack, the player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

card.name: Alchemist's Apprentice
card.ability: Sacrifice Alchemist's Apprentice: Draw a card.
card.flavor: #_Side effects may include foul odors, scalding steam, and spontaneous nonexistence._#

card.name: Alchemist's Refuge
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.£{G}{U}, {T}: You may cast nonland cards this turn as though they had flash.
card.flavor: #_Persecuted alchemists fled deep into Kessig's wilds, seeking solitude to continue their ghoulish craft._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : You can cast a nonland card with flash any time you could cast an instant. £5/1/2012 : The last ability applies to nonland cards in any zone, provided something is allowing you to cast them. For example, you could cast a sorcery with flashback as though it had flash.

card.name: Amass the Components
card.ability: Draw three cards, then put a card from your hand on the bottom of your library.
card.flavor: #_"I knew I'd find a use for all that newt spittle!"_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If you cast Amass the Components with fewer than three cards in your library, you'll draw the remaining cards in your library, put a card from your hand on the bottom of your library, then lose the game for drawing a card from a library with no cards in it the next time state-based actions are performed.

card.name: Angel of Glory's Rise
card.ability: Flying£When Angel of Glory's Rise enters the battlefield, exile all Zombies, then return all Human creature cards from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor: #_"Justice isn't done until undeath is undone."_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Only Zombie permanents on the battlefield are exiled. Zombie cards in other zones are not.
card.name_ES: Ángel del ascenso de la gloria

card.name: Angel of Jubilation
card.ability: Flying£Other nonblack creatures you control get +1/+1.£Players can't pay life or sacrifice creatures to cast spells or activate abilities.
card.flavor: #_"Though Innistrad is not cleansed of evil, we finally have cause to rejoice."_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If a spell or activated ability has a cost that requires a player to pay life (as Griselbrand's activated ability does) or sacrifice a creature (as Fling does), that spell or ability can't be cast or activated. £5/1/2012 : Other things may still cause players to pay life or sacrifice creatures, such as a resolving spell or ability. £5/1/2012 : Angel of Jubilation's last ability doesn't look for specific words on other cards. Rather, it stops players from taking specific actions. For example, you couldn't activate an ability with an activation of cost of "Sacrifice an artifact:" by sacrificing an artifact creature (although you could sacrifice a noncreature artifact).

card.name: Angelic Armaments
card.ability: Equipped creature gets +2/+2, has flying, and is a white Angel in addition to its other colors and types.£Equip {4}
card.flavor: #_Forged in dark hours from the flame that would not die._#

card.name: Angelic Wall
card.ability: Defender #_(This creature can't attack.)_#£Flying
card.flavor: #_"The air stirred as if fanned by angels' wings, and the enemy was turned aside."_#£#_—Tales of Ikarov the Voyager_#

card.name: Angel's Mercy
card.ability: You gain 7 life.
card.flavor: #_"I understand your fears. I pity your doubts. I absolve you of both."_#

card.name: Angel's Tomb
card.ability: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may have Angel's Tomb become a 3/3 white Angel artifact creature with flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"Faith can quicken the stones themselves with life."_#£#_—Writings of Mikaeus_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If Angel's Tomb is already a creature when a creature enters the battlefield, its ability will override any effects that set its power and toughness to specific values, but other changes to its power and toughness will still apply.

card.name: Appetite for Brains
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it with converted mana cost 4 or greater and exile that card.
card.flavor: #_Just as with a peach, the first bite is always the juiciest._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If a card in a player's hand has {X} in its mana cost, X is 0.

card.name: Arcane Melee
card.ability: Instant and sorcery spells cost {2} less to cast.
card.flavor: #_Debates between wizards are never purely academic._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Arcane Melee can't reduce the colored mana requirement of an instant or sorcery spell. £5/1/2012 : If there are additional costs to cast a spell, such as a kicker cost or a cost imposed by another effect (such as Thalia, Guardian of Thraben's ability), apply those increases before applying cost reductions. £5/1/2012 : Arcane Melee can reduce alternative costs such as miracle costs. £5/1/2012 : The cost to cast an instant or sorcery spell with one generic mana in its mana cost will be reduced by {1}. For example, an instant spell with a mana cost of {1}{G} would cost {G} to cast.

card.name: Archangel
card.ability: Flying, vigilance
card.flavor: #_The sky rang with the cries of armored seraphs, and the darkness made a tactical retreat._#

card.name: Archwing Dragon
card.ability: Flying, haste£At the beginning of the end step, return Archwing Dragon to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: #_Swifter than an angel, crueler than a demon, and relentless as a ghoul._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Archwing Dragon is only returned to its owner's hand if it's on the battlefield.

card.name: Avacyn, Angel of Hope
card.ability: Flying, vigilance, indestructible£Other permanents you control have indestructible.
card.flavor: #_A golden helix streaked skyward from the Helvault. A thunderous explosion shattered the silver monolith and Avacyn emerged, free from her prison at last._#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : Creatures with indestructible still have damage marked on them, even though that damage won't destroy them. If Avacyn leaves the battlefield, creatures that lose indestructible and have lethal damage marked on them will be destroyed. £7/1/2013 : A permanent with indestructible can't be destroyed, but it can still be sacrificed, exiled, put into a graveyard, and so on.
card.name_JP: 希望の天使アヴァシン

card.name: Banishing Stroke
card.ability: Put target artifact, creature, or enchantment on the bottom of its owner's library.£Miracle {W} #_(You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)_#

card.name: Banners Raised
card.ability: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_After the destruction of the Helvault, fearful mobs soon became fearless battalions._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Only creatures you control when Banners Raised resolves will get the bonus. Creatures that enter the battlefield or that you gain control of later in the turn will be unaffected.

card.name: Barter in Blood
card.ability: Each player sacrifices two creatures.
card.flavor: #_"We must all make sacrifices for the good of Innistrad."_#£#_—Sorin Markov_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The active player chooses which creatures will be sacrificed first, then each other player in turn order does the same. Then all creatures are sacrificed simultaneously. £5/1/2012 : If a player controls only one creature, that creature is sacrificed. £5/1/2012 : Barter in Blood doesn't target any creatures and may be cast even if a player controls fewer than two creatures.

card.name: Battle Hymn
card.ability: Add {R} to your mana pool for each creature you control.
card.flavor: #_"A church is just wood and walls. A congregation is the faithful praising the angels."_#£#_—Kolman, elder of Gatstaf_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Battle Hymn uses the stack and can be responded to. The amount of mana you add to your mana pool is based on the number of creatures you control when Battle Hymn resolves.

card.name: Bladed Bracers
card.ability: Equipped creature gets +1/+1.£As long as equipped creature is a Human or an Angel, it has vigilance.£Equip {2} #_({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)_#
card.flavor: #_Forged from the rubble of the Helvault._#

card.name: Blessings of Nature
card.ability: Distribute four +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures.£Miracle {G} #_(You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : You may choose up to four target creatures. You declare how many counters will be placed on each target creature as you cast Blessings of Nature. Each target must receive at least one counter.

card.name: Blood Artist
card.ability: Whenever Blood Artist or another creature dies, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: #_"Great art can never be created without great suffering."_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If Blood Artist and one or more other creatures die at the same time, its ability will trigger for each of those creatures.

card.name: Bloodflow Connoisseur
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Bloodflow Connoisseur.
card.flavor: #_"Death not for survival but for vanity and pleasure? This is the decadence I sought to curb."_#£#_—Sorin Markov_#

card.name: Bone Splinters
card.ability: As an additional cost to cast Bone Splinters, sacrifice a creature.£Destroy target creature.
card.flavor: #_"Which do you deserve, the heft of a femur or the graceful sharpness of a forearm? Decisions, decisions . . ."_#£#_—Gisa the Mad_#
card.ruling: £10/1/2008 : You could choose to target the creature you're going to sacrifice to pay for Bone Splinters. First you choose the target (at which time it's still on the battlefield), then you pay the costs (at which time you sacrifice it). The spell will be countered. £4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures. £4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Bonfire of the Damned
card.ability: Bonfire of the Damned deals X damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.£Miracle {X}{R} #_(You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Bonfire of the Damned targets only the player. Creatures with hexproof that player controls will be dealt damage by Bonfire of the Damned if it resolves. £5/1/2012 : If the player is an illegal target when Bonfire of the Damned tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. No damage will be dealt to any creature or player. £5/1/2012 : Preventing some or all of the damage dealt to the player won't affect the amount of damage dealt to each creature that player controls. The same is true for any effect that increases or decreases the amount of damage dealt to the player.
card.name_JP: 忌むべき者のかがり火

card.name: Borderland Ranger
card.ability: When Borderland Ranger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
card.flavor: #_"There's only one route from Kessig into Stensia. Unless you come with me."_#
card.name_JP: 国境地帯のレインジャー

card.name: Bower Passage
card.ability: Creatures with flying can't block creatures you control.
card.flavor: #_In the darkest hours, some denied Avacyn. Now the Kessig wilds are their only haven._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Bower Passage won't affect a blocking creature that gains flying after blockers are declared. £5/1/2012 : Creatures with reach can still block creatures you control.

card.name: Bruna, Light of Alabaster
card.ability: Flying, vigilance£Whenever Bruna, Light of Alabaster attacks or blocks, you may attach to it any number of Auras on the battlefield and you may put onto the battlefield attached to it any number of Aura cards that could enchant it from your graveyard and/or hand.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Only Auras that could legally enchant Bruna may be attached to it, whether they're being moved from other permanents or being put onto the battlefield. An Aura with "enchant land," for example, could not be attached to Bruna this way. £5/1/2012 : All of these Auras will become attached to Bruna before combat damage is dealt. If Bruna is attacking, these Auras become attached before blockers are declared.
card.name_JP: 雪花石を率いる者、ブルーナ

card.name: Builder's Blessing
card.ability: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.
card.flavor: #_"Mix the mortar with holy wards, or blood will run in the streets."_#£#_—Vadvar, Thraben stonewright_#

card.name: Burn at the Stake
card.ability: As an additional cost to cast Burn at the Stake, tap any number of untapped creatures you control.£Burn at the Stake deals damage to target creature or player equal to three times the number of creatures tapped this way.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Players may not respond to the paying of costs. Once Burn at the Stake has been announced and put on the stack, no one can try to respond by tapping any creatures. £5/1/2012 : The amount of damage Burn at the Stake deals won't change if any creatures tapped to cast it become untapped or leave the battlefield before it resolves. £5/1/2012 : All creatures tapped this way become tapped at the same time.

card.name: Butcher Ghoul
card.ability: Undying #_(When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)_#
card.flavor: #_Without a mind, it doesn't fear death. Without a soul, it doesn't mind killing._#

card.name: Call to Serve
card.ability: Enchant nonblack creature£Enchanted creature gets +1/+2, has flying, and is an Angel in addition to its other types.
card.flavor: #_Grace is a gift, never a reward._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If the enchanted creature becomes black, Call to Serve will be put into its owner's graveyard the next time state-based actions are performed.

card.name: Captain of the Mists
card.ability: Whenever another Human enters the battlefield under your control, untap Captain of the Mists.£{1}{U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target permanent.
card.flavor: #_"I am no mere ship's captain. The north wind is my accomplice. The tide is my first mate."_#

card.name: Cathars' Crusade
card.ability: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.
card.flavor: #_Avacyn's holy warriors kept hope alive in her darkest hours. Now they will carry that hope across Innistrad._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The creature that entered the battlefield and caused the ability to trigger will also get a +1/+1 counter, provided it's still on the battlefield when the ability resolves.

card.name: Cathedral Sanctifier
card.ability: When Cathedral Sanctifier enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
card.flavor: #_"Evil will soon be vanquished. What Innistrad most needs now is healing."_#

card.name: Cavern of Souls
card.ability: As Cavern of Souls enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.£{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.£{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast a creature spell of the chosen type, and that spell can't be countered.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : You must choose an existing _Magic_ creature type, such as Zombie or Warrior. Card types such as artifact can't be chosen. £5/1/2012 : The spell can't be countered if the mana produced by Cavern of Souls is spent to cover any cost of the spell, even an additional cost such as a kicker cost. This is true even if you use the mana to pay an additional cost while casting a spell "without paying its mana cost."

card.name: Champion of Lambholt
card.ability: Creatures with power less than Champion of Lambholt's power can't block creatures you control.£Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Champion of Lambholt.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Creatures with power less than Champion of Lambholt can't block any creature you control, not just Champion of Lambholt. £5/1/2012 : Champion of Lambholt's ability works even if it isn't attacking. £5/1/2012 : The comparison of power is only done when blockers are declared. Increasing the power of a blocking creature (or decreasing the power of Champion of Lambholt) after this point won't cause any creature to stop blocking or become unblocked.

card.name: Cloudshift
card.ability: Exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.
card.flavor: #_"Even storm clouds bow to worship Avacyn."_#£#_—Elder Rimheit_#

card.name: Commander's Authority
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your upkeep, put a 1/1 white Human creature token onto the battlefield."
card.flavor: #_"Wear her symbol with honor, a sign of faith upheld and honest deeds bravely done."_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The controller of the enchanted creature gets the token.

card.name: Conjurer's Closet
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, you may exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.
card.flavor: #_"Tomorrow wears yesterday's face."_#£#_—Kordel the Cryptic_#

card.name: Corpse Traders
card.ability: {2}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor: #_Those without breath can't complain._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : You can sacrifice Corpse Traders to pay the cost of its ability. £4/15/2013 : If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

card.name: Craterhoof Behemoth
card.ability: Haste£When Craterhoof Behemoth enters the battlefield, creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creatures you control.
card.flavor: #_Its footsteps of today are the lakes of tomorrow._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The bonus is calculated based on the number of creatures you control when Craterhoof Behemoth's ability resolves, potentially including itself. If that number increases or decreases later in the turn, the bonus won't change. £5/1/2012 : Only creatures you control when Craterhoof Behemoth's ability resolves will get the bonus. Creatures that enter the battlefield or that you gain control of later in the turn will be unaffected.

card.name: Crippling Chill
card.ability: Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.£Draw a card.
card.flavor: #_One breath of the geist turns veins to rivers of ice and freezes hearts midbeat._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Crippling Chill can target a creature that's already tapped. It still won't untap during its controller's next untap step. £5/1/2012 : Crippling Chill tracks the creature, but not its controller. If the creature changes controllers before its first controller's next untap step has come around, then it won't untap during its new controller's next untap step.

card.name: Crypt Creeper
card.ability: Sacrifice Crypt Creeper: Exile target card from a graveyard.
card.flavor: #_"I guess what they say is true. What doesn't kill you makes you stronger. Or at least stranger."_#£#_—Captain Eberhart_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : You must be able to target a card in a graveyard to activate Crypt Creeper's ability. It can't target itself.

card.name: Cursebreak
card.ability: Destroy target enchantment. You gain 2 life.
card.flavor: #_No longer the village pariah. No longer taunted and shamed. Sigrun was finally free._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If the enchantment is an illegal target when Cursebreak tries to resolve, it'll be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain 2 life.

card.name: Dangerous Wager
card.ability: Discard your hand, then draw two cards.
card.flavor: #_"C'mon friend, take a turn tossing the knucklebones. What've you got to lose?"_#£#_—Tobias, trader of Erdwal_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If you have no cards in hand when Dangerous Wager resolves, you'll simply draw two cards.

card.name: Dark Impostor
card.ability: {4}{B}{B}: Exile target creature and put a +1/+1 counter on Dark Impostor.£Dark Impostor has all activated abilities of all creature cards exiled with it.
card.flavor: #_"Ah, this is a nice life. I can see why you were so desperate to keep it."_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Dark Impostor gains only activated abilities. It doesn't gain triggered abilities or static abilities. Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]."
