Some keywords are activated abilities; they have colons in their reminder text. £5/1/2012 : If an activated ability of a card in exile references the card it's printed on by name, treat Dark Impostor's version of that ability as though it referenced Dark Impostor by name instead. For example, if Marrow Bats (which says "Pay 4 life: Regenerate Marrow Bats") is exiled with Dark Impostor, Dark Impostor has the ability "Pay 4 life: Regenerate Dark Impostor." £5/1/2012 : Dark Impostor can target and exile a permanent that's only a creature temporarily, like an animated land. However, because that card isn't a creature card, Dark Impostor won't have any of that card's activated abilities. £5/1/2012 : If you control more than one Dark Impostor, each will have only the activated abilities of creature cards exiled with that specific Dark Impostor. £5/1/2012 : Once Dark Impostor leaves the battlefield, it will no longer have the activated abilities of the creature cards exiled with it. If it returns to the battlefield, it will be a new Dark Impostor with no connection to those exiled cards.

card.name: Deadeye Navigator
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Deadeye Navigator is paired with another creature, each of those creatures has "{1}{U}: Exile this creature, then return it to the battlefield under your control."
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Once Deadeye Navigator or the creature it's paired with is exiled, the other creature will no longer have the activated ability. However, you can activate the ability of one creature in response to activating the ability of the other creature.

card.name: Death Wind
card.ability: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_Leukin stared at the smoldering angel feathers. "Run!" he screamed to his patrol. "We don't stand a chance!"_#

card.name: Defang
card.ability: Enchant creature£Prevent all damage that would be dealt by enchanted creature.
card.flavor: #_Once vampires are disarmed, they're given wooden swords and forced to assist in the training of Midnight Duelists._#

card.name: Defy Death
card.ability: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If it's an Angel, put two +1/+1 counters on it.
card.flavor: #_Gisela cornered the murderous demon among the graves of the dead villagers. "A fitting end," she murmured as she raised her sword._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : No player can cast spells or activate abilities between returning the creature card to the battlefield and checking whether it's an Angel. £5/1/2012 : If the creature is an Angel only on the battlefield (perhaps because it's a non-Angel creature card and Xenograft is on the battlefield), it will get the +1/+1 counters.

card.name: Demolish
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or land.
card.flavor: #_"To truly defeat a skaberen, you must destroy not the monster but the lab."_#£#_—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors_#

card.name: Demonic Rising
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, if you control exactly one creature, put a 5/5 black Demon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: #_Which is the greater folly, summoning the demon or expecting gratitude from it?_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If you control zero creatures or more than one creature at the beginning of your end step, the ability won't trigger. If you control zero creatures or more than one creature when the ability resolves, it will do nothing. £5/1/2012 : Although you must control exactly one creature both when the ability would trigger and when it would resolve in order for the ability to create the Demon token, that creature doesn't have to be the same one both times. For example, if the ability triggers, then you lose control of your one creature before it resolves, you can cast a creature with flash to make sure you control exactly one creature when the ability resolves.

card.name: Demonic Taskmaster
card.ability: Flying£At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Demonic Taskmaster.
card.flavor: #_Subservience to greater power is the only law in the pit._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If you control no other creatures, you won't sacrifice anything. £5/1/2012 : If Demonic Taskmaster leaves the battlefield after its ability triggers but before it resolves, you'll still have to sacrifice a creature. Notably, if you control two Demonic Taskmasters and no other creatures, each one will force you to sacrifice the other.

card.name: Demonlord of Ashmouth
card.ability: Flying£When Demonlord of Ashmouth enters the battlefield, exile it unless you sacrifice another creature.£Undying #_(When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Demonlord of Ashmouth's enters-the-battlefield ability will trigger no matter how it entered the battlefield, including because of its undying ability. £5/1/2012 : You don't have to sacrifice another creature, even if you control one. You may choose to exile Demonlord of Ashmouth.
card.name_IT: Signore dei Demoni di Fauci di Cenere

card.name: Descendants' Path
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card that shares a creature type with a creature you control, you may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Otherwise, put that card on the bottom of your library.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If you cast a card "without paying its mana cost," you can't pay any alternative costs. You can pay additional costs, such as kicker costs. If the card has mandatory additional costs, you must pay those. £5/1/2012 : If the card has {X} in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as its value. £5/1/2012 : If the revealed card is a creature card that shares a creature type with a creature you control, but you choose not to cast it, it stays on top of your library.

card.name: Descent into Madness
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a despair counter on Descent into Madness, then each player exiles X permanents he or she controls and/or cards from his or her hand, where X is the number of despair counters on Descent into Madness.
card.flavor: #_The stairs lead down in both directions._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : For each despair counter on Descent into Madness, you'll exile a permanent you control or exile a card from your hand, not both. £5/1/2012 : First you choose the permanents and/or cards from your hand that will be exiled. Then each other player in turn order does the same. Then all the chosen permanents and cards are exiled simultaneously. Players who choose after you will know what permanents you'll be exiling when they choose. They'll know how many cards you'll be exiling from your hand, but they won't see those cards. £5/1/2012 : If there are more counters on Descent into Madness than the total number of permanents you control plus the number of cards in your hand, you'll exile all permanents you control (including Descent into Madness) and all cards from your hand. £5/1/2012 : If Descent into Madness isn't on the battlefield when its ability resolves, use the number of counters on it when it left the battlefield to determine how many permanents and/or cards from hands to exile.

card.name: Desolate Lighthouse
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.£{1}{U}{R}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
card.flavor: #_A lonely sentinel facing gales, hurricanes, and tides of homicidal spirits._#

card.name: Devastation Tide
card.ability: Return all nonland permanents to their owners' hands.£Miracle {1}{U} #_(You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)_#
card.flavor: #_It's hard to argue with a force made of divine will._#

card.name: Devout Chaplain
card.ability: {T}, Tap two untapped Humans you control: Exile target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: #_"By Avacyn's decree, we shall cleanse these relics of their demonic past."_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : You can tap any two untapped Humans you control, including ones you haven't controlled continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn, to pay the cost of Devout Chaplain's activated ability. You must have controlled Devout Chaplain continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn, however.

card.name: Diregraf Escort
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Diregraf Escort is paired with another creature, both creatures have protection from Zombies.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Diregraf Escort can be paired with a Zombie. The protection will have no effect on the pairing.

card.name: Divine Deflection
card.ability: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to you and/or permanents you control this turn. If damage is prevented this way, Divine Deflection deals that much damage to target creature or player.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Divine Deflection's only target is the creature or player it may deal damage to. You choose that target as you cast Divine Deflection, not at the time it prevents damage. £5/1/2012 : If the targeted creature or player is an illegal target by the time Divine Deflection resolves, the entire spell is countered. No damage will be prevented. £5/1/2012 : Divine Deflection can prevent damage that would be dealt to you, one or more creatures you control, and/or one or more planeswalkers you control. £5/1/2012 : Divine Deflection can prevent damage from multiple sources dealing damage simultaneously (such as during combat). If the chosen value for X won't prevent all the damage, you choose which sources to prevent damage from. £5/1/2012 : If damage is dealt to multiple permanents you control, or is dealt to you and at least one permanent you control, you choose which of that damage to prevent if the chosen value for X won't prevent all the damage. For example, if 3 damage would be dealt to you and to each of two creatures you control, and Divine Deflection will prevent the next 3 damage, you might choose to prevent the next 2 damage it would deal to you and the next 1 damage it would deal to one of the creatures, among other choices. You don't decide until the point at which the damage would be dealt. £5/1/2012 : Divine Deflection's effect is not a redirection effect. If it prevents damage, Divine Deflection (not the original source) deals damage to the targeted creature or player as part of that prevention effect. Divine Deflection is the source of the new damage, so the characteristics of the original source (such as its color, or whether it had lifelink or deathtouch) don't affect this damage. The new damage is not combat damage, even if the prevented damage was. Since you control the source of the new damage, if you targeted an opponent with Divine Deflection, you may have Divine Deflection deal its damage to a planeswalker that opponent controls. £5/1/2012 : If Divine Deflection prevents damage, excess damage (if any) dealt by that source is dealt at the same time. Immediately afterward, as part of that same prevention effect, Divine Deflection deals its damage. This happens before state-based actions are checked, and before the spell or ability that caused damage to be dealt resumes its resolution. £5/1/2012 : Whether the targeted creature or player is still a legal target is not checked after Divine Deflection resolves. For example, if a creature targeted by Divine Deflection gains shroud after Divine Deflection resolves, Divine Deflection can still deal damage to that creature. £5/1/2012 : If Divine Deflection can't deal damage to the targeted creature or player (because the creature has gained protection from white, is no longer on the battlefield, or is no longer a creature, or the player is no longer in the game, for example), it will still prevent damage. It just won't deal any damage itself.

card.name: Dread Slaver
card.ability: Whenever a creature dealt damage by Dread Slaver this turn dies, return it to the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.
card.flavor: #_Half a brain rules the mindless._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Each time a creature dies, check whether Dread Slaver had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Dread Slaver's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into. £5/1/2012 : If Dread Slaver and a creature it was blocking or blocked by both die in combat, Dread Slaver's ability will trigger. £5/1/2012 : Dread Slaver will return if it somehow dealt damage to itself and then dies. £5/1/2012 : The card will return to the battlefield under your control only if it's still in the graveyard when the ability resolves. If it's not (perhaps because an ability like undying has already returned it to the battlefield), nothing happens.

card.name: Dreadwaters
card.ability: Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is the number of lands you control.
card.flavor: #_Stray into the Morkrut and it may rise to claim you._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The number of cards put into the graveyard is based on the number of lands you control when Dreadwaters resolves.

card.name: Driver of the Dead
card.ability: When Driver of the Dead dies, return target creature card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor: #_Some vampires resorted to corpse trading after cathars burned their estates and drove them from their ancestral feeding grounds._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If Driver of the Dead dies at the same time as a creature with converted mana cost 2 or less, you can target that card and return it to the battlefield.

card.name: Druid's Familiar
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Druid's Familiar is paired with another creature, each of those creatures gets +2/+2.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If Druid's Familiar becomes unpaired, it will immediately lose the +2/+2 bonus. If this causes it to have damage marked on it equal to it or greater than its new toughness, it will be destroyed. The same is true for the creature it was paired with.

card.name: Druids' Repository
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control attacks, put a charge counter on Druids' Repository.£Remove a charge counter from Druids' Repository: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The first ability of Druids' Repository will trigger once for each creature you control that attacks. £5/1/2012 : You can activate the second ability of Druids' Repository multiple times in the same turn. It's a mana ability, doesn't use the stack, and can't be responded to.

card.name: Dual Casting
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature has "{R}, {T}: Copy target instant or sorcery spell you control. You may choose new targets for the copy."
card.flavor: #_Hours after the Helvault opened, his powers returned twice as strong as before._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The ability granted by Dual Casting can target (and copy) any instant or sorcery spell you control, not just one with targets. £5/1/2012 : The copy is created on the stack, so it's not "cast." Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger. The copy will then resolve like a normal spell, after players get a chance to cast spells and activate abilities. £5/1/2012 : The copy will have the same targets as the spell it's copying unless you choose new ones. You may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, you can't choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal). £5/1/2012 : If the spell being copied is modal (that is, it says "Choose one --" or the like), the copy will have the same mode(s). You can't choose different ones. £5/1/2012 : If the spell being copied has an X whose value was determined as it was cast (like Earthquake does), the copy has the same value of X. £5/1/2012 : You can't choose to pay any additional costs for the copy. However, effects based on any additional costs that were paid for the original spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy too. For example, if you sacrifice a 3/3 creature to cast Fling and then copy it with the ability granted by Dual Casting, the copy of Fling will also deal 3 damage to its target.

card.name: Eaten by Spiders
card.ability: Destroy target creature with flying and all Equipment attached to that creature.
card.flavor: #_After sampling many victims, the spider developed a preference for the undead and their accoutrements._#

card.name: Elgaud Shieldmate
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Elgaud Shieldmate is paired with another creature, both creatures have hexproof. #_(They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)_#
card.name_JP: エルゴードの盾の仲間

card.name: Emancipation Angel
card.ability: Flying£When Emancipation Angel enters the battlefield, return a permanent you control to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: #_"You have done your best. I give you leave to rest."_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The triggered ability doesn't target a permanent. You choose which one to return to its owner's hand as the ability resolves. No one can respond to the choice. £5/1/2012 : If Emancipation Angel is still on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves, you may return Emancipation Angel itself.

card.name: Entreat the Angels
card.ability: Put X 4/4 white Angel creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.£Miracle {X}{W}{W} #_(You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)_#

card.name: Essence Harvest
card.ability: Target player loses X life and you gain X life, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.
card.flavor: #_Captain Lewenheart uncovered evidence of a demon cult among the clergy. The Skirsdag never gave him a chance to prove his case._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The value of X is determined when Essence Harvest resolves. If you control no creatures that time, no life will be lost or gained. £5/1/2012 : Essence Harvest targets only the player. It doesn't target any creatures. If that player is an illegal target when Essence Harvest tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. No life will be lost or gained.

card.name: Evernight Shade
card.ability: {B}: Evernight Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.£Undying #_(When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Evernight Shade's ability doesn't put +1/+1 counters on it; it just gives Evernight Shade +1/+1 until end of turn. If Evernight Shade has no +1/+1 counters on it and dies after its ability has resolved, undying will still return it to the battlefield.

card.name: Exquisite Blood
card.ability: Whenever an opponent loses life, you gain that much life.
card.flavor: #_Even as humans regained the upper hand, some still willingly traded their lives for a chance at immortality._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Damage dealt to an opponent usually causes that opponent to lose life. An opponent paying life also causes loss of life. £5/1/2012 : If you and an opponent both lose life simultaneously, and this causes your life total to become 0 or less, you'll lose the game before Exquisite Blood's triggered ability can resolve.

card.name: Falkenrath Exterminator
card.ability: Whenever Falkenrath Exterminator deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.£{2}{R}: Falkenrath Exterminator deals damage to target creature equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on Falkenrath Exterminator.
card.name_JP: ファルケンラスの駆除屋

card.name: Farbog Explorer
card.ability: Swampwalk #_(This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)_#
card.flavor: #_"I'd slog through a thousand swamps to help one soul find rest."_#

card.name: Favorable Winds
card.ability: Creatures you control with flying get +1/+1.
card.flavor: #_Long thought to be extinct, flocks of gryffs reappeared with Avacyn's return._#

card.name: Fervent Cathar
card.ability: Haste£When Fervent Cathar enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.
card.flavor: #_"I'll put my sword down only to die. And I don't plan on doing that today."_#

card.name: Fettergeist
card.ability: Flying£At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Fettergeist unless you pay {1} for each other creature you control.
card.flavor: #_The choices of the living will tether them in death._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The amount of mana you need to pay is determined when the triggered ability resolves.

card.name: Fleeting Distraction
card.ability: Target creature gets -1/-0 until end of turn.£Draw a card.
card.flavor: #_The first spell taught to young mages, it has spared the lives of many whose hands are too small to hold a sword._#
card.ruling: £6/15/2010 : If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Fleeting Distraction resolves, the spell is countered. You won't draw a card. £5/1/2012 : If the targeted creature is an illegal target when Fleeting Distraction tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't draw a card.

card.name: Flowering Lumberknot
card.ability: Flowering Lumberknot can't attack or block unless it's paired with a creature with soulbond.
card.flavor: #_"It used to eat us trappers. Now it follows us around like some kind of hound dog."_#£#_—Alena, trapper of Kessig_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Whether Flowering Lumberknot is paired is checked only when attackers or blockers are declared. After that point, Flowering Lumberknot becoming unpaired won't cause it to stop attacking or blocking. £5/1/2012 : If the creature Flowering Lumberknot is paired with loses soulbond, Flowering Lumberknot will remain paired but won't be able to attack or block.

card.name: Gallows at Willow Hill
card.ability: {3}, {T}, Tap three untapped Humans you control: Destroy target creature. Its controller puts a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : You can tap any three untapped Humans you control, including ones you haven't controlled continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn, to pay the cost of the activated ability. £5/1/2012 : If the targeted creature is an illegal target when the ability tries to resolve, the ability will be countered and none of its effects will happen. The creature's controller won't put a Spirit token onto the battlefield.
card.name_FR: Gibet de la Colline des Saules
card.name_ES: Cadalso de la Colina del Sauce

card.name: Galvanic Alchemist
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Galvanic Alchemist is paired with another creature, each of those creatures has "{2}{U}: Untap this creature."

card.name: Gang of Devils
card.ability: When Gang of Devils dies, it deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures and/or players.
card.flavor: #_"Well, how could I know they'd explode?"_#£#_—Gregel, township militia_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : You divide the damage as you put Gang of Devils's triggered ability on the stack, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage. (In other words, as you put the ability on the stack, you choose whether to have it deal 3 damage to a single target, 2 damage to one target and 1 damage to another target, or 1 damage to each of three targets.)

card.name: Geist Snatch
card.ability: Counter target creature spell. Put a 1/1 blue Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: #_Angels and demons aren't the only ones listening to your prayers._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If the target creature spell is an illegal target when Geist Snatch tries to resolve, Geist Snatch will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't put a Spirit token onto the battlefield. £5/1/2012 : If Geist Snatch resolves but the creature spell can't be countered, you'll still put the Spirit token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Geist Trappers
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Geist Trappers is paired with another creature, both creatures have reach.

card.name: Ghostform
card.ability: Up to two target creatures can't be blocked this turn.
card.flavor: #_"There's no such thing as ‘impenetrable.'"_#

card.name: Ghostly Flicker
card.ability: Exile two target artifacts, creatures, and/or lands you control, then return those cards to the battlefield under your control.
card.flavor: #_Sometimes it's useful to take a break from existence._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The two targets can have different card types. For example, you can target one artifact and one creature with Ghostly Flicker.

card.name: Ghostly Touch
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature has "Whenever this creature attacks, you may tap or untap target permanent."
card.flavor: #_"Geists wish to make themselves known. I'm merely the vessel for their efforts."_#

card.name: Ghoulflesh
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.
card.flavor: #_The body dies in stages. First the skin, then the muscle. The brain is last, much to the victim's dismay._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If Ghoulflesh causes a creature to have 0 toughness or have damage marked on it equal to or greater than its toughness, it will be a black Zombie (in addition to its other colors and types) when it dies.

card.name: Gisela, Blade of Goldnight
card.ability: Flying, first strike£If a source would deal damage to an opponent or a permanent an opponent controls, that source deals double that damage to that player or permanent instead.£If a source would deal damage to you or a permanent you control, prevent half that damage, rounded up.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Gisela doubles damage dealt to opponents and permanents your opponents control from any source, including sources controlled by those opponents. £5/1/2012 : If multiple replacement effects would modify how damage would be dealt, the player being dealt damage (or the controller of the permanent being dealt damage) chooses the order in which to apply those effects. £5/1/2012 : If damage dealt by a source you control is being divided among multiple permanents an opponent controls or among an opponent and one or more permanents he or she controls simultaneously, divide the original amount and double the results. For example, if you attack with a 5/5 creature with trample and your opponent blocks with a 2/2 creature, you can assign 2 damage to the blocker and 3 damage to the defending player. These amounts are then doubled to 4 and 6 damage, respectively. You can't double the damage to 10 first and then assign 2 to the creature and 8 to the player.
card.name_ES: Gisela, Espada de la Noche Dorada

card.name: Gloom Surgeon
card.ability: If combat damage would be dealt to Gloom Surgeon, prevent that damage and exile that many cards from the top of your library.
card.flavor: #_He roams the streets of Havengul seeking the sick and delirious so that he may cure them of their lives._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Combat damage that would be dealt to Gloom Surgeon will be prevented even if you can't exile that many cards from the top of your library. £5/1/2012 : If damage that can't be prevented (such as the damage Malignus deals) is dealt to Gloom Surgeon, you'll still exile cards from your library.

card.name: Gloomwidow
card.ability: Reach£Gloomwidow can block only creatures with flying.
card.flavor: #_The abandoned towns on the moors didn't stay empty for long._#

card.name: Goldnight Commander
card.ability: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"One faith, but many hands in victory."_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The creature that entered the battlefield will also get +1/+1 until end of turn if it's still on the battlefield when the ability resolves.

card.name: Goldnight Redeemer
card.ability: Flying£When Goldnight Redeemer enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life for each other creature you control.
card.flavor: #_The Host sings of Avacyn's return without a single verse about its own suffering._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The amount of life you gain is based on the number of other creatures you control when the ability resolves.

card.name: Grave Exchange
card.ability: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand. Target player sacrifices a creature.
card.flavor: #_"It's a cold, dark journey either way."_#£#_—Eruth of Lambholt_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Grave Exchange targets both a creature card in your graveyard and a player. You can't cast it unless there is a legal target to choose for both. You can target a player who controls no creatures. £5/1/2012 : If both targets are illegal when Grave Exchange tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. If only one target is legal, the effect relevant to that target will happen and the other will not.

card.name: Griselbrand
card.ability: Flying, lifelink£Pay 7 life: Draw seven cards.
card.flavor: #_"Avacyn emerged from the broken Helvault, but her freedom came at a price—him."_#£#_—Thalia, Knight-Cathar_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : You can't activate Griselbrand's ability if you have 6 or less life.

card.name: Grounded
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature loses flying.
card.flavor: #_"We've tracked Ludevic's monster across four provinces. When it lands, make sure it stays put."_#£#_—Alena, trapper of Kessig,_#£#_to Halana of Ulvenwald_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The creature can later gain flying from another effect. That will override Grounded's effect.

card.name: Gryff Vanguard
card.ability: Flying£When Gryff Vanguard enters the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor: #_"Ghouls smashed the door, but I heard the call of the gryffs and knew we were saved."_#£#_—Ekka, shopkeeper of Hanweir_#

card.name: Guise of Fire
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature gets +1/-1 and attacks each turn if able.
card.flavor: #_"Fire will eventually destroy a zombie, but a fiery zombie destroys a lot of other things first."_#£#_—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The controller of the enchanted creature still decides which player or planeswalker the creature attacks. £5/1/2012 : If, during its controller's declare attackers step, the enchanted creature is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or hasn't been under that player's control continuously since the turn began (and doesn't have haste), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having a creature attack, the player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

card.name: Hanweir Lancer
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Hanweir Lancer is paired with another creature, both creatures have first strike.

card.name: Harvester of Souls
card.ability: Deathtouch£Whenever another nontoken creature dies, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: #_"He is judge, jury, and executioner because he killed them all."_#£#_—Bishop Cawle of Elgaud_#

card.name: Haunted Guardian
card.ability: Defender, first strike
card.flavor: #_"Drain the victim's blood, sell the corpse, and use the soul on guard duty. No muss, no fuss, no problems."_#£#_—Olivia Voldaren_#

card.name: Havengul Skaab
card.ability: Whenever Havengul Skaab attacks, return another creature you control to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: #_An abomination so violent that the other fiends tremble at the sight of it._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If you don't control any other creatures, the ability won't do anything.
card.name_JP: ヘイヴングルのスカーブ

card.name: Havengul Vampire
card.ability: Whenever Havengul Vampire deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.£Whenever another creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Havengul Vampire.
card.flavor: #_"That slowly decreasing pulse—that's the beat I waltz to."_#
card.name_JP: ヘイヴングルの吸血鬼

card.name: Heirs of Stromkirk
card.ability: Intimidate #_(This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)_#£Whenever Heirs of Stromkirk deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

card.name: Herald of War
card.ability: Flying£Whenever Herald of War attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it.£Angel spells and Human spells you cast cost {1} less to cast for each +1/+1 counter on Herald of War.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The +1/+1 counter is put on Herald of War before blockers are declared and combat damage is dealt. £5/1/2012 : The cost reduction is based on the total number of +1/+1 counters on Herald of War, not just the ones put on it by its own ability. £5/1/2012 : If there are additional costs to cast a creature spell, such as a kicker cost, apply those increases before applying cost reductions. £5/1/2012 : A creature spell that's both an Angel and a Human will cost {1} less to cast for each +1/+1 counter on Herald of War.

card.name: Holy Justiciar
card.ability: {2}{W}, {T}: Tap target creature. If that creature is a Zombie, exile it.
card.flavor: #_Her eyes see through the rotting flesh and glimpse a soul in agony, begging for the Blessed Sleep._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If the creature is an untapped Zombie, it will become tapped, then exiled.

card.name: Homicidal Seclusion
card.ability: As long as you control exactly one creature, that creature gets +3/+1 and has lifelink.
card.flavor: #_"Damned crows and their endless squawking . . . blocks out the voices in my head . . ."_#£#_—Hermit of Hanne Hall_#

card.name: Hound of Griselbrand
card.ability: Double strike£Undying #_(When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)_#
card.name_JP: グリセルブランドの猟犬

card.name: Howlgeist
card.ability: Creatures with power less than Howlgeist's power can't block it.£Undying #_(When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The comparison of power is performed only when blockers are declared. Increasing the power of a blocking creature (or decreasing the power of Howlgeist) after this point won't cause any creature to stop blocking or become unblocked.

card.name: Human Frailty
card.ability: Destroy target Human creature.
card.flavor: #_"I have seen a hundred mortal families rise and fall. I shall outlast a thousand more."_#£#_—Olivia Voldaren_#

card.name: Hunted Ghoul
card.ability: Hunted Ghoul can't block Humans.
card.flavor: #_Even after Hanweir was saved, Gisa's lost ghouls would shamble through, still following the twisted orders of their imprisoned master._#
card.name_JP: 狩り立てられたグール

card.name: Infinite Reflection
card.ability: Enchant creature£When Infinite Reflection enters the battlefield attached to a creature, each other nontoken creature you control becomes a copy of that creature.£Nontoken creatures you control enter the battlefield as a copy of enchanted creature.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Infinite Reflection can enchant a creature controlled by another player. £5/1/2012 : If Infinite Reflection enters the battlefield attached to a creature and then becomes attached to a different creature before its enters-the-battlefield trigger resolves, each other nontoken creature you control will become a copy of the first creature. £5/1/2012 : If Infinite Reflection leaves the battlefield or becomes attached to a different creature, none of the copy effects end. Your creatures will still be copies of whatever creature each was a copy of. £5/1/2012 : If Infinite Reflection enters the battlefield attached to a token creature, the nontoken creatures that become copies of that creature are not themselves tokens. £5/1/2012 : Creatures you control don't copy whether the enchanted creature is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it, whether it has any Auras and Equipment attached to it, or any noncopy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on. £5/1/2012 : Because creatures you control enter the battlefield as a copy of the enchanted creature, any enters-the-battlefield triggered abilities printed on such creatures won't trigger. However, if the enchanted creature has any enters-the-battlefield triggered abilities, those will trigger. £5/1/2012 : Replacement effects that modify how a permanent enters the battlefield are now applied in the following order: control-changing effects (such as Gather Specimens), then copy effects (such as the abilities of Infinite Reflection and Clone), then all other effects. £5/1/2012 : If a creature such as Clone is entering the battlefield under your control, there will be two copy effects to apply: the creature's own and Infinite Reflection's. No matter what order these effects are applied, the creature will be a copy of the enchanted creature when it enters the battlefield. £5/1/2012 : Other enters-the-battlefield replacement abilities printed on the creature entering the battlefield won't be applied because the creature will already be a copy of the enchanted creature at that point (and therefore it won't have those abilities). For example, if the enchanted creature is Serra Angel, a creature that normally enters the battlefield tapped will enter the battlefield as an untapped copy of Serra Angel, and a creature that would normally enter the battlefield with counters on it will enter the battlefield as a copy of Serra Angel with no counters. £5/1/2012 : External abilities may still affect how a creature enters the battlefield. For example, if your opponent controls Urabrask the Hidden, which reads, in part, "Creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped," a creature entering the battlefield under your control will be a tapped copy of the enchanted creature. £5/1/2012 : If you control more than one Infinite Reflection, you can apply those copy effects in any order. Creatures you control will enter the battlefield as a copy of the one whose copy effect you apply last.

card.name: Into the Void
card.ability: Return up to two target creatures to their owners' hands.
card.flavor: #_"The cathars have their swords, the inquisitors their axes. I prefer the ‘diplomatic' approach."_#£#_—Terhold, archmage of Drunau_#

card.name: Joint Assault
card.ability: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If it's paired with a creature, that creature also gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"By my power, werewolves shall become the wolfir, our allies in combat against darkness."_#£#_—Avacyn's Cursemute Decree_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Joint Assault targets only one creature. If that creature is an illegal target when Joint Assault tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. No creature will get +2/+2. £5/1/2012 : Joint Assault checks whether the target creature is paired only when it resolves. If it becomes unpaired later in the turn, neither creature will lose the bonus. Similarly, if it becomes paired later in the turn, the creature it's paired with won't gain the bonus.

card.name: Kessig Malcontents
card.ability: When Kessig Malcontents enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target player equal to the number of Humans you control.
card.flavor: #_Discontent is a powerful weapon in the hands of a mob._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The number of Humans you control is counted when the enters-the-battlefield ability resolves.

card.name: Killing Wave
card.ability: For each creature, its controller sacrifices it unless he or she pays X life.
card.flavor: #_"I come looking for demons and I find a plane full of angels. I hate angels."_#£#_—Liliana Vess_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : First, the active player chooses whether to pay X life for each creature he or she controls. Then each other player in turn order chooses for his or her creatures. Then each player pays life and sacrifices creatures at the same time. Players will know the decisions of players who chose before them. £5/1/2012 : A player may choose to pay life for some creatures and sacrifice the rest. It's not an all-or-nothing decision. £5/1/2012 : You can't pay more life than you have. £5/1/2012 : If you can't sacrifice a creature (perhaps because of Sigarda, Host of Herons), you can choose not to pay life and nothing will happen.

card.name: Kruin Striker
card.ability: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, Kruin Striker gets +1/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_Unhappy with the creation of the wolfir, Rorica broke with her order and led a crusade against the "reformed werewolves."_#

card.name: Lair Delve
card.ability: Reveal the top two cards of your library. Put all creature and land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.flavor: #_"The fiends have fled. Well, good riddance. Nothing I like more than an empty lair."_#

card.name: Latch Seeker
card.ability: Latch Seeker can't be blocked.
card.flavor: #_It seeks a tomb that will hold it, a coffin that will give it rest._#

card.name: Leap of Faith
card.ability: Target creature gains flying until end of turn. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to that creature this turn.
card.flavor: #_The finest maneuvers take place in three dimensions._#

card.name: Lightning Mauler
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Lightning Mauler is paired with another creature, both creatures have haste.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : A creature that loses haste after it's been declared as an attacking creature doesn't stop attacking.

card.name: Lightning Prowess
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature has haste and "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
card.flavor: #_"Undead flesh is dry and papery. A single spark and ‘poof.' No more ghoul."_#

card.name: Lone Revenant
card.ability: Hexproof #_(This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)_#£Whenever Lone Revenant deals combat damage to a player, if you control no other creatures, look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : You must put one of the cards into your hand, even if you'd rather put all four on the bottom of your library. £5/1/2012 : If you control Lone Revenant and any other creature (including another Lone Revenant), its ability won't trigger. £5/1/2012 : Check whether Lone Revenant's ability triggers after combat damage is dealt but before any creatures that are destroyed due to combat damage leave the battlefield. For example, if you control Lone Revenant and another creature, and that other creature takes lethal damage in the same combat damage step that Lone Revenant deals damage to a player, Lone Revenant's ability won't trigger. £5/1/2012 : If you control no creatures when Lone Revenant's ability resolves, you'll still look at the top four cards and put one into your hand.

card.name: Lunar Mystic
card.ability: Whenever you cast an instant spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.
card.flavor: #_"I'm pleased this world has learned the moon affects more than the tides."_#£#_—Tamiyo, the Moon Sage_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The triggered ability will go on the stack on top of the instant spell and resolve before it. £5/1/2012 : The decision to pay {1} is made when the triggered ability resolves. It's not an additional cost of the instant spell.

card.name: Maalfeld Twins
card.ability: When Maalfeld Twins dies, put two 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: #_"Who am I to break up a family?"_#£#_—Gisa the Mad_#

card.name: Mad Prophet
card.ability: Haste£{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
card.flavor: #_"There's no heron in the moon! It's a shrew, a five-legged shrew, with a voice like whispering thunder!"_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Discarding a card is part of the ability's activation cost. You can't activate the ability if you have no cards in hand.

card.name: Malicious Intent
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature has "{T}: Target creature can't block this turn."
card.flavor: #_As peace returned to Thraben, some cathars made the mistake of letting down their guard._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Once a creature has been declared as a blocking creature, making it unable to block will have no effect.

card.name: Malignus
card.ability: Malignus's power and toughness are each equal to half the highest life total among your opponents, rounded up.£Damage that would be dealt by Malignus can't be prevented.
card.flavor: #_It descended on Estwald like a sudden storm. Moments later, only ashes and agony remained._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If Malignus becomes blocked by a creature with protection from red, the damage Malignus deals to that creature won't be prevented.

card.name: Marrow Bats
card.ability: Flying£Pay 4 life: Regenerate Marrow Bats.
card.flavor: #_"No matter how far we push into Stensia, undeath will always remain in these lands."_#£#_—Terhold, archmage of Drunau_#

card.name: Mass Appeal
card.ability: Draw a card for each Human you control.
card.flavor: #_"We have emerged triumphant from the darkness. Let our hard-won wisdom guide us to prosperity."_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The number of Humans you control is counted only when Mass Appeal resolves.

card.name: Mental Agony
card.ability: Target player discards two cards and loses 2 life.
card.flavor: #_"His mind is feeble. Feed him to the bats."_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If the targeted player has fewer than two cards in his or her hand, that player will still lose 2 life (and discard one card, if applicable).

card.name: Midnight Duelist
card.ability: Protection from Vampires
card.flavor: #_Avacyn's return did not rid him of his desire for revenge._#

card.name: Midvast Protector
card.ability: When Midvast Protector enters the battlefield, target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"I cultivated my faith in Avacyn despite meager returns. Now my faith is repaid."_#
card.name_JP: ミッドヴァストの守護者

card.name: Mist Raven
card.ability: Flying£When Mist Raven enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: #_"When you see a raven, head for the hills. It knows when the ghost-tide is headed in."_#£#_—Sved, fisherman of Nephalia_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Mist Raven's ability is mandatory. If Mist Raven is the only creature on the battlefield when its ability triggers, you must choose it as the target.

card.name: Misthollow Griffin
card.ability: Flying£You may cast Misthollow Griffin from exile.
card.flavor: #_For some creatures, existing is only a whim._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Misthollow Griffin can also be cast from a player's hand. £5/1/2012 : Misthollow Griffin doesn't have an ability that exiles itself. Some other effect will be needed to get the card into exile. £5/1/2012 : You must still pay Misthollow Griffin's mana cost when you cast it from exile. £5/1/2012 : Misthollow Griffin's ability doesn't change when you can cast creature spells: when you have priority during your main phase when the stack is empty.

card.name: Moonlight Geist
card.ability: Flying£{3}{W}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by Moonlight Geist this turn.
card.flavor: #_Wails and whispers are the only weapons she has left._#

card.name: Moonsilver Spear
card.ability: Equipped creature has first strike.£Whenever equipped creature attacks, put a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying onto the battlefield.£Equip {4}

card.name: Moorland Inquisitor
card.ability: {2}{W}: Moorland Inquisitor gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_Inquisitors are taught scripture, philosophy, and the fine art of sharpening an axe._#
card.name_JP: ムーアランドの審問官

card.name: Narstad Scrapper
card.ability: {2}: Narstad Scrapper gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"Finally, the principles of corpse animation applied to bloodless materials!"_#£#_—Ludevic, necro-alchemist_#
card.name_JP: ナースタードの潰し屋

card.name: Natural End
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 3 life.
card.flavor: #_The haunted blade shattered, and the geist drifted gratefully to the Blessed Sleep._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If the artifact or enchantment is an illegal target when Natural End tries to resolve, Natural End will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain 3 life.

card.name: Nearheath Pilgrim
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Nearheath Pilgrim is paired with another creature, both creatures have lifelink.

card.name: Necrobite
card.ability: Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn. Regenerate it.
card.flavor: #_An undead snake doesn't bite in self-defense. It hungers as any zombie, never sated._#

card.name: Nephalia Smuggler
card.ability: {3}{U}, {T}: Exile another target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.
card.flavor: #_"My drivers are trustworthy. I removed their tongues myself. Any other questions?"_#

card.name: Nettle Swine
card.flavor: #_"I killed one and found bricks and bones in its belly. It had eaten a whole cottage, thatch and all."_#£#_—Paulin, Somberwald trapper_#

card.name: Nightshade Peddler
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Nightshade Peddler is paired with another creature, both creatures have deathtouch.

card.name: Otherworld Atlas
card.ability: {T}: Put a charge counter on Otherworld Atlas.£{T}: Each player draws a card for each charge counter on Otherworld Atlas.
card.flavor: #_"Any fool can open it. But it takes a genius to decipher the blank pages."_#£#_—Kordel the Cryptic_#

card.name: Outwit
card.ability: Counter target spell that targets a player.
card.flavor: #_The student asks how a spell is begun. The master ponders what ends it._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The spell you target could also target other things, as long as it also targets a player.

card.name: Pathbreaker Wurm
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Pathbreaker Wurm is paired with another creature, both creatures have trample.

card.name: Peel from Reality
card.ability: Return target creature you control and target creature you don't control to their owners' hands.
card.flavor: #_"Soulless demon, you are bound to me. Now we will both dwell in oblivion."_#

card.name: Pillar of Flame
card.ability: Pillar of Flame deals 2 damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.
card.flavor: #_"May the worthy spend an eternity in Blessed Sleep. May the wicked find the peace of oblivion."_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : A creature dealt damage by Pillar of Flame that dies that turn will be exiled even if it wasn't the target of Pillar of Flame (because the damage was redirected somehow). £5/1/2012 : A creature dealt damage by Pillar of Flame that turn will be exiled no matter why the creature would die. It could have its toughness reduced to 0 or less or be destroyed by another spell or ability.

card.name: Polluted Dead
card.ability: When Polluted Dead dies, destroy target land.
card.flavor: #_After the zombie attack, crops withered on the vine, and the thriving village became a ghost town almost overnight._#

card.name: Predator's Gambit
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.£Enchanted creature has intimidate as long as its controller controls no other creatures. #_(It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)_#

card.name: Primal Surge
card.ability: Exile the top card of your library. If it's a permanent card, you may put it onto the battlefield. If you do, repeat this process.
card.flavor: #_With Avacyn's return, the flow of life became a tidal wave._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : A permanent card is an artifact, creature, enchantment, land, or planeswalker card. £5/1/2012 : Repeating the process includes the instruction to repeat the process. That is, you'll keep exiling cards and putting them onto the battlefield until you fail to put a permanent card onto the battlefield. £5/1/2012 : If you exile a permanent card that you can't put onto the battlefield (such as an Aura with nothing legal to enchant) or one you don't want to put onto the battlefield, Primal Surge finishes resolving. £5/1/2012 : If putting any of those permanent cards onto the battlefield causes abilities to trigger, those abilities will wait to go on the stack until Primal Surge has finished resolving. Starting with the active player, each player puts his or her abilities on the stack in any order.

card.name: Raging Poltergeist
card.flavor: #_Some tried cremating their dead to stop the ghoulcallers. But the dead returned, furious about their fate._#
card.name_JP: 怒れるポルターガイスト

card.name: Rain of Thorns
card.ability: Choose one or more — Destroy target artifact; destroy target enchantment; and/or destroy target land.
card.flavor: #_When the forests became havens for evil, the archmages devised new ways to cleanse the wilds._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : You can choose just one mode, any two of the modes, or all three. You make this choice as you cast Rain of Thorns.

card.name: Reforge the Soul
card.ability: Each player discards his or her hand and draws seven cards.£Miracle {1}{R} #_(You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)_#
card.flavor: #_In a wave of spells called the Cursemute, Avacyn cleansed the world with divine fire._#

card.name: Renegade Demon
card.flavor: #_"Have you ever cornered a wounded vampire? That's a walk in the cathedral garden in comparison."_#£#_—Tristen, Cathar Marshal_#

card.name: Restoration Angel
card.ability: Flash£Flying£When Restoration Angel enters the battlefield, you may exile target non-Angel creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.

card.name: Revenge of the Hunted
card.ability: Until end of turn, target creature gets +6/+6 and gains trample, and all creatures able to block it this turn do so.£Miracle {G} #_(You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)_#

card.name: Riders of Gavony
card.ability: Vigilance£As Riders of Gavony enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.£Human creatures you control have protection from creatures of the chosen type.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : You must choose an existing _Magic_ creature type, such as Zombie or Warrior. Card types such as artifact can't be chosen.

card.name: Righteous Blow
card.ability: Righteous Blow deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor: #_"Monsters will no longer find safety under the mists of Morkrut!"_#£#_—Bruna, Light of Alabaster_#

card.name: Riot Ringleader
card.ability: Whenever Riot Ringleader attacks, Human creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"So the vampires like hot blood, do they? Let's see how they handle ours."_#

card.name: Rite of Ruin
card.ability: Choose an order for artifacts, creatures, and lands. Each player sacrifices one permanent of the first type, sacrifices two of the second type, then sacrifices three of the third type.
card.flavor: #_Skirsdag cultists refused to quietly accept Avacyn's ascendancy._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : First you choose the order for the card types. Then each player in turn order (starting with the active player) chooses one permanent he or she controls of the first card type. Then those permanents are sacrificed at the same time. Then each player in turn order chooses two permanents he or she controls of the second card type. Then those permanents are sacrificed at the same time. Finally, each player in turn order chooses three permanents of the third card type, then those permanents are sacrificed at the same time. £5/1/2012 : Permanents sacrificed for one card type won't be on the battlefield to be chosen for subsequent card types. £5/1/2012 : If any abilities trigger while Rite of Ruin is resolving, those abilities will wait until Rite of Ruin finishes resolving before going on the stack. Starting with the active player, each player puts his or her abilities on the stack in any order.

card.name: Rotcrown Ghoul
card.ability: When Rotcrown Ghoul dies, target player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: #_"Don't look into its eyes. It's thinking things no dead thing should think."_#£#_—Captain Eberhart_#

card.name: Rush of Blood
card.ability: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is its power.
card.flavor: #_Sometimes it's not for sustenance or to feed the dependence. Sometimes it's just to feel again._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The value of X is determined when Rush of Blood resolves. The bonus won't change later in the turn if the creature's power changes. £5/1/2012 : If the creature has power less than 0, the "bonus" will be negative. For example, a creature that's somehow become -1/3 would get -1/+0 and become -2/3.

card.name: Scalding Devil
card.ability: {2}{R}: Scalding Devil deals 1 damage to target player.
card.flavor: #_Demons massacre. Devils annoy._#

card.name: Scrapskin Drake
card.ability: Flying£Scrapskin Drake can block only creatures with flying.
card.flavor: #_"The cathars killed my skaabs down below. Let's see how high their swords can reach."_#£#_—Ludevic, necro-alchemist_#

card.name: Scroll of Avacyn
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice Scroll of Avacyn: Draw a card. If you control an Angel, you gain 5 life.
card.flavor: #_Words to bless the eye that reads them, telling of a future beyond the reach of fear._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Whether you control an Angel is checked when the ability resolves.

card.name: Scroll of Griselbrand
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice Scroll of Griselbrand: Target opponent discards a card. If you control a Demon, that player loses 3 life.
card.flavor: #_Words no eyes should see, telling of things no sane mind could fathom._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Whether you control a Demon is checked when the ability resolves.
card.name_JP: グリセルブランドの巻物

card.name: Searchlight Geist
card.ability: Flying£{3}{B}: Searchlight Geist gains deathtouch until end of turn. #_(Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)_#
card.flavor: #_It rises with the fall of darkness, seeking souls to extinguish._#

card.name: Second Guess
card.ability: Counter target spell that's the second spell cast this turn.
card.flavor: #_"I see where you're going with that. I don't like it."_#£#_—Dierk, geistmage_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Second Guess can't be cast unless the spell it targets is the second spell cast this turn. £5/1/2012 : It doesn't matter if the first spell cast that turn has resolved yet or not. It also doesn't matter how many spells have been cast after the second one, as long as the second spell cast is still on the stack. £5/1/2012 : Most spells and abilities that copy a spell create that copy on the stack. These copies are not cast and won't count toward the number of spells cast that turn. However, a few (like Isochron Scepter's ability) instruct you to copy a spell and "cast the copy." These spells are cast and will count toward the number of spells cast that turn.

card.name: Seraph of Dawn
card.ability: Flying£Lifelink #_(Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)_#
card.flavor: #_She parts the clouds so sunlight can reach even the darkest lairs and duskiest tombs._#

card.name: Seraph Sanctuary
card.ability: When Seraph Sanctuary enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.£Whenever an Angel enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.£{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

card.name: Sheltering Word
card.ability: Target creature you control gains hexproof until end of turn. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness. #_(A creature with hexproof can't be the target of spells or abilities opponents control.)_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If a creature gains hexproof in response to a spell or ability controlled by an opponent that targets only it, that spell or ability will countered for having an illegal target when it tries to resolve.

card.name: Sigarda, Host of Herons
card.ability: Flying, hexproof£Spells and abilities your opponents control can't cause you to sacrifice permanents.
card.flavor: #_Great devotion yields great reward._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : As a spell or ability an opponent controls resolves, if it would force you to sacrifice a permanent, you just don't. That part of the effect does nothing. If that spell or ability gives you the option to sacrifice a permanent (as Brain Gorger's ability does), you can't take that option. £5/1/2012 : If a spell or ability an opponent controls instructs you to perform an action unless you sacrifice a permanent (as Ogre Marauder does), you can't choose to sacrifice a permanent. You must perform the action. On the other hand, if a spell or ability an opponent controls instructs you to sacrifice a permanent unless you perform an action (as Killing Wave does), you can choose whether or not to perform the action. If you don't perform the action, nothing happens, since you can't sacrifice any permanents. £5/1/2012 : You may still sacrifice permanents to pay the costs of spells you cast and abilities you activate, or because a resolving spell or ability you control instructs or allows you to do so. £5/1/2012 : You may sacrifice a permanent to pay the activation cost of an ability, even if that ability comes from a permanent an opponent controls (such as Excavation). £5/1/2012 : You may sacrifice a permanent as a special action, even if the effect that allows you to do so comes from an opponent's permanent (such as Damping Engine or Volrath's Curse). No one controls special actions. £5/1/2012 : This ability affects only sacrifices. It won't stop a creature from being put into the graveyard due to lethal damage or having 0 toughness, and it won't stop a permanent from being put into the graveyard due to the "legend rule" or the "planeswalker uniqueness rule." None of these are sacrifices; they're the result of game rules.
card.name_FR: Sigarda de la Milice des hérons

card.name: Silverblade Paladin
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Silverblade Paladin is paired with another creature, both creatures have double strike.

card.name: Slayers' Stronghold
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.£{R}{W}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains vigilance and haste until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_Its courtyards are lit during every hour of the day so that night may never fall within its walls._#

card.name: Snare the Skies
card.ability: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains reach until end of turn. #_(It can block creatures with flying.)_#
card.flavor: #_A hunter's precision and a durkvine's strength are a potent combination._#

card.name: Somberwald Sage
card.ability: {T}: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast creature spells.
card.flavor: #_"You can face any danger when all of nature is on your side."_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Mana produced by Somberwald Sage can be spent on any part of a creature spell's total cost. This includes additional costs (such as kicker) and alternative costs (such as evoke costs). £5/1/2012 : Mana produced by Somberwald Sage can't be spent on activated abilities, even ones that put a creature card directly onto the battlefield, such as unearth or ninjutsu. £5/1/2012 : Mana produced by Somberwald Sage can't be spent on noncreature spells that would put creature tokens onto the battlefield.
card.name_JP: ソンバーワルドの賢者

card.name: Somberwald Vigilante
card.ability: Whenever Somberwald Vigilante becomes blocked by a creature, Somberwald Vigilante deals 1 damage to that creature.
card.flavor: #_He has nothing left but his resentment._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Somberwald Vigilante's ability will trigger for each creature it becomes blocked by. £5/1/2012 : The ability resolves before combat damage is dealt, so it could cause blocking creatures to be destroyed and thus not deal combat damage.
card.name_JP: ソンバーワルドの自警団

card.name: Soul of the Harvest
card.ability: Trample£Whenever another nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: #_It's there when a seed sprouts, when gourds ripen on the vines, and when the reapers cut the grains under the Harvest Moon._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : A creature card that enters the battlefield as a copy of a token creature is still a nontoken creature. You'll be able to draw a card.

card.name: Soulcage Fiend
card.ability: When Soulcage Fiend dies, each player loses 3 life.
card.flavor: #_Vowing to free the souls of her children, Kastinne followed the tormentors into the ghastly network of caves below Stensia._#
card.name_FR: Fielleux de la cage aux âmes

card.name: Spectral Gateguards
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Spectral Gateguards is paired with another creature, both creatures have vigilance.

card.name: Spectral Prison
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.£When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell, sacrifice Spectral Prison.

card.name: Spirit Away
card.ability: Enchant creature£You control enchanted creature.£Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
card.flavor: #_The fear of slipping from the geist's tenuous grip overwhelmed Tolo's joy at his first flight._#

card.name: Stern Mentor
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Stern Mentor is paired with another creature, each of those creatures has "{T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard."

card.name: Stolen Goods
card.ability: Target opponent exiles cards from the top of his or her library until he or she exiles a nonland card. Until end of turn, you may cast that card without paying its mana cost.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : You cast the card from exile. Each land card exiled this way will remain exiled. £5/1/2012 : If you can't cast the nonland card (perhaps because there are no legal targets available) or if you choose not to cast it, it will remain exiled. £5/1/2012 : You must follow the normal timing restrictions of the exiled card. £5/1/2012 : If you cast a card "without paying its mana cost," you can't pay any alternative costs. You can pay additional costs, such as kicker costs. If the card has mandatory additional costs, you must pay those. £5/1/2012 : If the card has {X} in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as its value. £5/1/2012 : If there are no nonland cards left in that library, the opponent will exile all cards from his or her library, and Stolen Goods will finish resolving.

card.name: Stonewright
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Stonewright is paired with another creature, each of those creatures has "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."

card.name: Tamiyo, the Moon Sage
card.ability: +1: Tap target permanent. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.£-2: Draw a card for each tapped creature target player controls.£-8: You get an emblem with "You have no maximum hand size" and "Whenever a card is put into your graveyard from anywhere, you may return it to your hand."
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Tamiyo's first ability tracks the permanent, but not its controller. If the permanent changes controllers before its first controller's next untap step has come around, then it won't untap during its new controller's next untap step. £5/1/2012 : The number of tapped creatures the player controls is determined when Tamiyo's second ability resolves. £5/1/2012 : Tamiyo's third ability creates one emblem with two abilities. £5/1/2012 : If you activate Tamiyo's third ability when she has eight loyalty counters on her, she'll be put into your graveyard before the emblem is created. She won't return to your hand. £5/1/2012 : Cards that are put into your graveyard can be returned to your hand by the emblem's ability even if they were never in your hand. £7/1/2013 : The ability can target a tapped permanent. If the targeted permanent is already tapped when it resolves, that permanent just remains tapped and doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step. £7/1/2013 : Planeswalkers are permanents. You can cast one at the time you could cast a sorcery. When your planeswalker spell resolves, it enters the battlefield under your control. £7/1/2013 : Planeswalkers are not creatures. Spells and abilities that affect creatures won’t affect them. £7/1/2013 : Planeswalkers have loyalty. A planeswalker enters the battlefield with a number of loyalty counters on it equal to the number printed in its lower right corner. Activating one of its abilities may cause it to gain or lose loyalty counters. Damage dealt to a planeswalker causes that many loyalty counters to be removed from it. If it has no loyalty counters on it, it’s put into its owner’s graveyard as a state-based action. £7/1/2013 : Planeswalkers each have a number of activated abilities called “loyalty abilities.” You can activate a loyalty ability of a planeswalker you control only at the time you could cast a sorcery and only if you haven’t activated one of that planeswalker’s loyalty abilities yet that turn. £7/1/2013 : The cost to activate a planeswalker’s loyalty ability is represented by a symbol with a number inside. Up-arrows contain positive numbers, such as “+1”; this means “Put one loyalty counter on this planeswalker.” Down-arrows contain negative numbers, such as “-7”; this means “Remove seven loyalty counters from this planeswalker.” A symbol with a “0” means “Put zero loyalty counters on this planeswalker.” £7/1/2013 : You can’t activate a planeswalker’s ability with a negative loyalty cost unless the planeswalker has at least that many loyalty counters on it. £7/1/2013 : Planeswalkers can’t attack (unless an effect turns the planeswalker into a creature). However, they can be attacked. Each of your attacking creatures can attack your opponent or a planeswalker that player controls. You say which as you declare attackers. £7/1/2013 : If your planeswalkers are being attacked, you can block the attackers as normal. £7/1/2013 : If a creature that’s attacking a planeswalker isn’t blocked, it’ll deal its combat damage to that planeswalker. Damage dealt to a planeswalker causes that many loyalty counters to be removed from it. £7/1/2013 : If a source you control would deal noncombat damage to an opponent, you may have that source deal that damage to a planeswalker that opponent controls instead. For example, although you can’t target a planeswalker with Shock, you can target your opponent with Shock, and then as Shock resolves, choose to have Shock deal its 2 damage to one of your opponent’s planeswalkers. (You can’t split up that damage between different players and/or planeswalkers.) If you have Shock deal its damage to a planeswalker, two loyalty counters are removed from it. £7/1/2013 : If a player controls two or more planeswalkers that share a planeswalker type, that player chooses one of them and the rest are put into their owners’ graveyards as a state-based action.
card.name_FR: Tamiyo, le sage de la lune
card.name_ES: Tamiyo, la Sabia de la Luna

card.name: Tandem Lookout
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Tandem Lookout is paired with another creature, each of those creatures has "Whenever this creature deals damage to an opponent, draw a card."

card.name: Temporal Mastery
card.ability: Take an extra turn after this one. Exile Temporal Mastery.£Miracle {1}{U} #_(You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)_#
card.flavor: #_Time is a marvelous plaything._#

card.name: Terminus
card.ability: Put all creatures on the bottom of their owners' libraries.£Miracle {W} #_(You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Each player chooses the order for his or her own creatures. This order isn't revealed to other players.

card.name: Terrifying Presence
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by creatures other than target creature this turn.
card.flavor: #_Elmut had slaughtered vampires, slain werewolves, and destroyed hordes of zombies. Sadly, he never got over his fear of spiders._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Although Terrifying Presence doesn't affect the target creature, if that creature is an illegal target when Terrifying Presence tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. No damage will be prevented.

card.name: Thatcher Revolt
card.ability: Put three 1/1 red Human creature tokens with haste onto the battlefield. Sacrifice those tokens at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor: #_The dark times left the peasantry ready to fight with whatever weapons were at hand._#

card.name: Thraben Valiant
card.ability: Vigilance
card.flavor: #_"Once more into Devil's Breach, soldiers. I want another devil tail for my collection."_#

card.name: Thunderbolt
card.ability: Choose one — Thunderbolt deals 3 damage to target player; or Thunderbolt deals 4 damage to target creature with flying.
card.flavor: #_"My next aerial design will use less metal."_#£#_—Hadaken, alchemist of Nephalia_#

card.name: Thunderous Wrath
card.ability: Thunderous Wrath deals 5 damage to target creature or player.£Miracle {R} #_(You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)_#

card.name: Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded
card.ability: +1: Draw a card, then discard a card at random.£-4: Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded deals damage equal to the number of cards in target player's hand to that player.£-6: Gain control of all creatures until end of turn. Untap them. They gain haste until end of turn.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The number of cards in the target player's hand is determined when Tibalt's second ability resolves. £5/1/2012 : When Tibalt's third ability resolves, all creatures will become untapped and gain haste, including ones you controlled before the ability resolved. £7/1/2013 : Planeswalkers are permanents. You can cast one at the time you could cast a sorcery. When your planeswalker spell resolves, it enters the battlefield under your control. £7/1/2013 : Planeswalkers are not creatures. Spells and abilities that affect creatures won’t affect them. £7/1/2013 : Planeswalkers have loyalty. A planeswalker enters the battlefield with a number of loyalty counters on it equal to the number printed in its lower right corner. Activating one of its abilities may cause it to gain or lose loyalty counters. Damage dealt to a planeswalker causes that many loyalty counters to be removed from it. If it has no loyalty counters on it, it’s put into its owner’s graveyard as a state-based action. £7/1/2013 : Planeswalkers each have a number of activated abilities called “loyalty abilities.” You can activate a loyalty ability of a planeswalker you control only at the time you could cast a sorcery and only if you haven’t activated one of that planeswalker’s loyalty abilities yet that turn. £7/1/2013 : The cost to activate a planeswalker’s loyalty ability is represented by a symbol with a number inside. Up-arrows contain positive numbers, such as “+1”; this means “Put one loyalty counter on this planeswalker.” Down-arrows contain negative numbers, such as “-7”; this means “Remove seven loyalty counters from this planeswalker.” A symbol with a “0” means “Put zero loyalty counters on this planeswalker.” £7/1/2013 : You can’t activate a planeswalker’s ability with a negative loyalty cost unless the planeswalker has at least that many loyalty counters on it. £7/1/2013 : Planeswalkers can’t attack (unless an effect turns the planeswalker into a creature). However, they can be attacked. Each of your attacking creatures can attack your opponent or a planeswalker that player controls. You say which as you declare attackers. £7/1/2013 : If your planeswalkers are being attacked, you can block the attackers as normal. £7/1/2013 : If a creature that’s attacking a planeswalker isn’t blocked, it’ll deal its combat damage to that planeswalker. Damage dealt to a planeswalker causes that many loyalty counters to be removed from it. £7/1/2013 : If a source you control would deal noncombat damage to an opponent, you may have that source deal that damage to a planeswalker that opponent controls instead. For example, although you can’t target a planeswalker with Shock, you can target your opponent with Shock, and then as Shock resolves, choose to have Shock deal its 2 damage to one of your opponent’s planeswalkers. (You can’t split up that damage between different players and/or planeswalkers.) If you have Shock deal its damage to a planeswalker, two loyalty counters are removed from it. £7/1/2013 : If a player controls two or more planeswalkers that share a planeswalker type, that player chooses one of them and the rest are put into their owners’ graveyards as a state-based action.
card.name_JP: 悪鬼の血統、ティボルト

card.name: Timberland Guide
