card.ability: When Timberland Guide enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
card.flavor: #_"Can you build a fire? Track a deer? Identify killer trees? Then you'll never survive Kessig without me."_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : You may choose Timberland Guide as the target of its own ability.

card.name: Tormentor's Trident
card.ability: Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and attacks each turn if able.£Equip {3}
card.flavor: #_To a demon there is no such thing as restraint._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : You still decide which player or planeswalker the equipped creature attacks. £5/1/2012 : If, during your declare attackers step, the equipped creature is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or hasn't been under your control continuously since the turn began (and doesn't have haste), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having a creature attack, you're not forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

card.name: Treacherous Pit-Dweller
card.ability: When Treacherous Pit-Dweller enters the battlefield from a graveyard, target opponent gains control of it.£Undying #_(When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)_#

card.name: Triumph of Cruelty
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent discards a card if you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power.
card.flavor: #_"I've seen corpses prettier than you, beastmage."_#£#_—Liliana Vess_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Triumph of Cruelty's ability will trigger at the beginning of each of your upkeeps regardless of who controls the creature with the greatest power. The ability checks whether the opponent will discard a card when it resolves.

card.name: Triumph of Ferocity
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card if you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power.
card.flavor: #_"Rid me of this curse, witch, or die with me."_#£#_—Garruk Wildspeaker_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Triumph of Ferocity's ability will trigger at the beginning of each of your upkeeps regardless of who controls the creature with the greatest power. The ability checks whether you'll draw a card when it resolves.

card.name: Trusted Forcemage
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Trusted Forcemage is paired with another creature, each of those creatures gets +1/+1.

card.name: Tyrant of Discord
card.ability: When Tyrant of Discord enters the battlefield, target opponent chooses a permanent he or she controls at random and sacrifices it. If a nonland permanent is sacrificed this way, repeat this process.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Repeating the process includes the instruction to repeat the process. That is, the opponent will keep sacrificing permanents until he or she sacrifices a land. £5/1/2012 : Repeating the process does not include targeting an opponent. Only one opponent will have to sacrifice permanents. £5/1/2012 : If any abilities trigger while Tyrant of Discord's enters-the-battlefield ability is resolving, those abilities will wait until the enters-the-battlefield ability finishes resolving before going on the stack. Starting with the active player, each player puts his or her abilities on the stack in any order. £5/1/2012 : If the target opponent can't sacrifice permanents (perhaps because of Sigarda, Host of Herons), the opponent will choose a permanent at random but not sacrifice it. The ability will then finish resolving.

card.name: Ulvenwald Tracker
card.ability: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature you control fights another target creature. #_(Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)_#
card.flavor: #_"Peace will come to Innistrad, but only after all abominations have been dealt with, one by one."_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The second target may be a creature any player controls, including you. £5/1/2012 : If either or both targets are illegal when Ulvenwald Tracker's ability tries to resolve, no creature will deal or be dealt damage.
card.name_JP: ウルヴェンワルドの足跡追い

card.name: Uncanny Speed
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"To survive, we must embrace the savagery we knew in our race's infancy."_#£#_—Edgar Markov_#

card.name: Undead Executioner
card.ability: When Undead Executioner dies, you may have target creature get -2/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_Heartless killer in life, brainless killer in death._#

card.name: Unhallowed Pact
card.ability: Enchant creature£When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control.
card.flavor: #_Agreements with demons seldom end at the grave._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The card will return to the battlefield under your control only if it's still in the graveyard when Unhallowed Pact's ability resolves. If it's not (perhaps because an ability like undying has already returned it to the battlefield), nothing happens. £5/1/2012 : If Unhallowed Pact is enchanting a token creature, that creature can't return to the battlefield.

card.name: Vanguard's Shield
card.ability: Equipped creature gets +0/+3 and can block an additional creature.£Equip {3} #_({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)_#
card.flavor: #_Wars are not fought on a single front._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Abilities that allow a creature to block an additional creature are cumulative.

card.name: Vanishment
card.ability: Put target nonland permanent on top of its owner's library.£Miracle {U} #_(You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)_#

card.name: Vessel of Endless Rest
card.ability: When Vessel of Endless Rest enters the battlefield, put target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.£{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Vexing Devil
card.ability: When Vexing Devil enters the battlefield, any opponent may have it deal 4 damage to him or her. If a player does, sacrifice Vexing Devil.
card.flavor: #_It's not any fun until someone loses an eye._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : If a player chooses to have Vexing Devil deal 4 damage to him or her, but some or all of that damage is prevented or redirected, Vexing Devil will still be sacrificed.

card.name: Vigilante Justice
card.ability: Whenever a Human enters the battlefield under your control, Vigilante Justice deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: #_It begins as a whisper and ends with the red roar of fire._#

card.name: Voice of the Provinces
card.ability: Flying£When Voice of the Provinces enters the battlefield, put a 1/1 white Human creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: #_Her horn is heard across Innistrad, lifting the hearts of the righteous._#

card.name: Vorstclaw
card.flavor: #_"Where'd the werewolves go? Maybe that got hungry."_#£#_—Halana of Ulvenwald_#

card.name: Wandering Wolf
card.ability: Creatures with power less than Wandering Wolf's power can't block it.
card.flavor: #_Humans still feared wolves, though no connection between them and the curse of lycanthropy had ever been proved._#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The comparison of power is only done when blockers are declared. Increasing the power of a blocking creature (or decreasing the power of Wandering Wolf) after this point won't cause any creature to stop blocking or become unblocked.

card.name: Wild Defiance
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control becomes the target of an instant or sorcery spell, that creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"When civilization reaches out its greedy hand, take it off at the wrist."_#£#_—Garruk Wildspeaker_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : Wild Defiance's ability will resolve before that instant or sorcery spell. £5/1/2012 : If an instant or sorcery spell targets the same creature you control more than once, Wild Defiance will trigger only once.

card.name: Wildwood Geist
card.ability: Wildwood Geist gets +2/+2 as long as it's your turn.
card.flavor: #_The geists that dwell in the deep forests of Kessig are as untamable as the woods themselves._#

card.name: Wingcrafter
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Wingcrafter is paired with another creature, both creatures have flying.

card.name: Wolfir Avenger
card.ability: Flash #_(You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)_#£{1}{G}: Regenerate Wolfir Avenger.
card.flavor: #_Released from a dark curse and bound to a higher calling._#

card.name: Wolfir Silverheart
card.ability: Soulbond #_(You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)_#£As long as Wolfir Silverheart is paired with another creature, each of those creatures gets +4/+4.

card.name: Yew Spirit
card.ability: {2}{G}{G}: Yew Spirit gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is its power.
card.flavor: #_"I wonder what dwelled in the primordial forests before humans existed."_#£#_—Elder Rimheit_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The value of X is determined when the ability resolves. The bonus won't change later in the turn if the creature's power changes. £5/1/2012 : If Yew Spirit has power less than 0, the "bonus" will be negative. For example, if it's somehow become -10/3, it would get -10/-10 and become -20/-7.

card.name: Zealous Conscripts
card.ability: Haste£When Zealous Conscripts enters the battlefield, gain control of target permanent until end of turn. Untap that permanent. It gains haste until end of turn.
card.ruling: £5/1/2012 : The enters-the-battlefield ability can target any permanent, including one that's untapped or one that you already control.

card.name: Zealous Strike
card.ability: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"Cower, fiend. The night is yours no longer."_#

card.name: Afflicted Deserter
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Afflicted Deserter.

card.name: Alpha Brawl
card.ability: Target creature an opponent controls deals damage equal to its power to each other creature that player controls, then each of those creatures deals damage equal to its power to that creature.
card.flavor: #_Being an alpha means proving it every full moon._#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : The two parts of Alpha Brawl's effect happen sequentially: first the targeted creature deals damage, then the other creatures deal damage. State-based actions aren't checked in the middle, so creatures that are dealt lethal damage by the targeted creature will still deal damage. £1/22/2011 : None of the damage dealt due to Alpha Brawl is combat damage. £1/22/2011 : Combat abilities like first strike, double strike, and trample don't apply and will have no impact on Alpha Brawl's effect. £1/22/2011 : Abilities like lifelink and deathtouch that care about any kind of damage are taken into account. £1/22/2011 : If the targeted creature has infect or wither, the damage it deals will result in -1/-1 counters being put on each creature it deals damage to. The power of those creatures will be reduced when they deal damage back to the targeted creature. £1/22/2011 : The damage dealt by the targeted creature is not divided in any way. For example, if a 3/3 creature is targeted, it will deal 3 damage to each other creature controlled by its controller.

card.name: Altar of the Lost
card.ability: Altar of the Lost enters the battlefield tapped.£{T}: Add two mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast spells with flashback from a graveyard.
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Altar of the Lost doesn't allow you to cast spells from any other player's graveyard, although you can spend the mana it produces on such spells if something else allows you to. £1/22/2011 : You can spend mana produced by Altar of the Lost to cast any spell with flashback that you cast from a graveyard. You don't have to be using flashback to cast that spell, however, as long as something else is allowing you to cast that spell.

card.name: Archangel's Light
card.ability: You gain 2 life for each card in your graveyard, then shuffle your graveyard into your library.
card.flavor: #_"This is the light of Avacyn. Even in her absence she offers us hope."_#£#_—Radulf, priest of Avacyn_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Archangel's Light isn't put into the graveyard until after its instructions are followed. You won't gain 2 life for it, and it won't be shuffled into your library. £1/22/2011 : If you have no cards in your graveyard, you won't gain any life, but you'll still shuffle your library.

card.name: Archdemon of Greed
card.ability: Flying, trample£At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a Human. If you can't, tap Archdemon of Greed and it deals 9 damage to you.

card.name: Artful Dodge
card.ability: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.£Flashback {U} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#
card.flavor: #_Those who know the alleys and sewers of the Erdwal can disappear like smoke._#

card.name: Avacyn's Collar
card.ability: Equipped creature gets +1/+0 and has vigilance.£Whenever equipped creature dies, if it was a Human, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.£Equip {2}
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : The triggered ability checks whether the equipped creature as it last existed on the battlefield was a Human. (It doesn't matter what its creature types are in the graveyard.)

card.name: Bar the Door
card.ability: Creatures you control get +0/+4 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"It may not look like much, but it's a good old door with strong wards. It'll hold."_#£#_—Olgard of the Skiltfolk_#

card.name: Beguiler of Wills
card.ability: {T}: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of creatures you control.
card.flavor: #_"Come, let me free you of the tyranny of thought."_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : In order to activate the ability, you must be able to target a creature with power less than or equal to the number of creatures you control. The comparison is made again when the ability resolves. If the power is greater than the number of creatures you control at that time, the target is illegal and the ability is countered. £1/22/2011 : The control-changing effect lasts indefinitely, even if the power of the creature becomes greater than the number of creatures you control after the ability resolves.

card.name: Black Cat
card.ability: When Black Cat dies, target opponent discards a card at random.
card.flavor: #_Its last life is spent tormenting your dreams._#

card.name: Blood Feud
card.ability: Target creature fights another target creature. #_(Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)_#
card.flavor: #_Succession is a matter of blood, and by blood it is often decided._#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Blood Feud can target two creatures with the same controller.

card.name: Bone to Ash
card.ability: Counter target creature spell.£Draw a card.
card.flavor: #_"I can think of worse ways to go. On second thought, maybe not."_#£#_—Ludevic, necro-alchemist_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : If the creature spell is an illegal target (because it's left the stack, for example) when Bone to Ash tries to resolve, Bone to Ash will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't draw a card. £1/22/2011 : A creature spell that can't be countered by spells and abilities is a legal target for Bone to Ash. The creature spell won't be countered when Bone to Ash resolves, but you'll still draw a card.

card.name: Break of Day
card.ability: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.£#_Fateful hour_# — If you have 5 or less life, those creatures gain indestructible until end of turn. #_(Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them.)_#
card.ruling: £7/1/2013 : Because Break of Day affects only creatures you control when it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn. £7/1/2013 : Break of Day checks your life total only at the time it resolves. Any creatures that gain indestructible will continue to be indestructible that turn even if you gain life.

card.name: Briarpack Alpha
card.ability: Flash #_(You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)_#£When Briarpack Alpha enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"The wolves turned on us and a chill swept over me. The pack had a new leader."_#£#_—Alena, trapper of Kessig_#
card.name_FR: Alpha de la meute de bruyère
card.name_ES: Alfa de la Manada del Brezo

card.name: Burden of Guilt
card.ability: Enchant creature£{1}: Tap enchanted creature.
card.flavor: #_"Grab an axe and defend the gate! Your despair is an extravagance we can ill afford."_#£#_—Thalia, Knight-Cathar_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Only Burden of Guilt's controller can activate its ability.

card.name: Burning Oil
card.ability: Burning Oil deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.£Flashback {3}{W} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#
card.flavor: #_Every now and then, a devil's prank can give you a good idea._#

card.name: Call to the Kindred
card.ability: Enchant creature£At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top five cards of your library. If you do, you may put a creature card that shares a creature type with enchanted creature from among them onto the battlefield, then you put the rest of those cards on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : The creature need only share one creature type with enchanted creature, not necessarily all of them. For example, if the enchanted creature was a Human Soldier, you could put a Human Wizard creature card, a Goblin Soldier creature card, or a Human Soldier Ally creature card onto the battlefield.

card.name: Chalice of Death
card.ability: {T}: Target player loses 5 life.

card.name: Chalice of Life
card.ability: {T}: You gain 1 life. Then if you have at least 10 life more than your starting life total, transform Chalice of Life.

card.name: Chant of the Skifsang
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature gets -13/-0.
card.flavor: #_The skifsang, seafarers of Nephalia, craft spells like other sailors craft nets—making them strong enough to snare even the deadliest catch._#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : A creature with power 0 or less assigns no combat damage. (It doesn't assign a negative amount of combat damage.)

card.name: Chill of Foreboding
card.ability: Each player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.£Flashback {7}{U} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#
card.flavor: #_"Wait . . . did you fellows hear something?"_#

card.name: Chosen of Markov
card.ability: {T}, Tap an untapped Vampire you control: Transform Chosen of Markov.
card.name_JP: マルコフに選ばれし者

card.name: Clinging Mists
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.£#_Fateful hour_# — If you have 5 or less life, tap all attacking creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : In most cases, attacking creatures will already be tapped. They still won't untap during their controller's next untap step. £1/22/2011 : Clinging Mists doesn't track the controller of the attacking creatures. If one of them changes controller before its previous controller's next untap step, it won't untap during its new controller's next untap step.

card.name: Counterlash
card.ability: Counter target spell. You may cast a nonland card in your hand that shares a card type with that spell without paying its mana cost.
card.flavor: #_"Pathetic. Let me show you how it's done."_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : You cast the card in your hand as part of the resolution of Counterlash. Timing restrictions based on the card's type (such as creature or sorcery) are ignored. Other restrictions are not (such as "Cast [this card] only during combat"). £1/22/2011 : If you cast a card "without paying its mana cost," you can't pay any alternative costs. You can pay additional costs, such as kicker costs. If the card has mandatory additional costs, you must pay those. £1/22/2011 : If the card has {X} in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as its value.

card.name: Crushing Vines
card.ability: Choose one — Destroy target creature with flying; or destroy target artifact.
card.flavor: #_"Your veil's curse won't stop me, deathmage. I have taken down countless night hunters and this dark plane is not big enough for you to hide."_#£#_—Garruk Wildspeaker, to Liliana Vess_#

card.name: Curse of Bloodletting
card.ability: Enchant player£If a source would deal damage to enchanted player, it deals double that damage to that player instead.
card.flavor: #_It is the demon's mark, an infernal claim on the flesh of the guilty._#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Curse of Bloodletting works with any damage, not just combat damage. It also doesn't matter who controls the source of the damage that's being dealt. £1/22/2011 : The source of the damage doesn't change. A spell that deals damage will specify the source of the damage, often the spell itself. An ability that deals damage will also specify the source of the damage, although the ability itself will never be that source. Often the source of the ability is also the source of the damage. £1/22/2011 : If more than one Curse of Bloodletting enchants the same player, damage dealt to that player will double for each one (two of them will end up multiplying the damage by four, three of them by eight, and four of them by sixteen). £1/22/2011 : If multiple effects modify how damage will be dealt to the enchanted player, that player chooses the order to apply the effects. For example, Mending Hands says, "Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn." Suppose a spell would deal 5 damage to enchanted player and that player has cast Mending Hands targeting him or herself. The enchanted player can either (a) prevent 4 damage first and then let Curse of Bloodletting's effect double the remaining 1 damage, taking 2 damage, or (b) double the damage to 10 and then prevent 4 damage, taking 6 damage. £1/22/2011 : If the enchanted player controls a planeswalker and noncombat damage is being dealt to the player from a source controlled by an opponent, the enchanted player will choose whether to apply Curse of Bloodletting or the planeswalker redirection effect first. If the player chooses to apply the planeswalker redirection effect first, and the opponent chooses to redirect the damage to the planeswalker, then Curse of Bloodletting won't double the damage.

card.name: Curse of Echoes
card.ability: Enchant player£Whenever enchanted player casts an instant or sorcery spell, each other player may copy that spell and may choose new targets for the copy he or she controls.
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : When the triggered ability resolves, it creates a copy of that spell for each other player. The active player creates his or her copy and may choose new targets first (if that player isn't the enchanted player), then each other player (except the enchanted player) creates his or her copy and may choose new targets in turn order. The last player who creates his or her copy controls the copy that will resolve first. £1/22/2011 : All the copies are created on the stack, so none of them are cast. Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger. The copies will then resolve as normal, after players get a chance to cast spells and activate abilities. £1/22/2011 : Each copy will have the same targets as the spell it's copying unless its controller chooses new ones. That player may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, that player can't choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal). £1/22/2011 : If the original spell is modal (that is, it says "Choose one --" or the like), each copy will have the same mode(s). You can't choose different ones. £1/22/2011 : If the original spell has an X whose value was determined as it was cast, each copy has the same value of X. £1/22/2011 : You can't choose to pay any additional costs for the copy. However, effects based on any additional costs that were paid for the original spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy too. For example, if the enchanted player sacrifices a 3/3 creature to cast Fling, each copy of Fling will also deal 3 damage.

card.name: Curse of Exhaustion
card.ability: Enchant player£Enchanted player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
card.flavor: #_"I do believe your heresy will prove more difficult now that you have more pressing concerns."_#£#_—Bishop Argust_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Curse of Exhaustion will look at the entire turn to see if the enchanted player has cast a spell yet that turn, even if Curse of Exhaustion wasn't on the battlefield when that spell was cast.

card.name: Curse of Misfortunes
card.ability: Enchant player£At the beginning of your upkeep, you may search your library for a Curse card that doesn't have the same name as a Curse attached to enchanted player, put it onto the battlefield attached to that player, then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : The Curse card you put onto the battlefield must have a different name than each other Curse enchanting the enchanted player when the triggered ability resolves. If multiple of these abilities trigger, the Curse card you put onto the battlefield when the first resolves may impact your choices for each subsequent one.

card.name: Curse of Thirst
card.ability: Enchant player£At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, Curse of Thirst deals damage to that player equal to the number of Curses attached to him or her.
card.flavor: #_"May you drink until you drown but never be sated."_#£#_—Odila, witch of Morkrut_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : The number of Curses attached to the player is counted when the ability resolves.

card.name: Dawntreader Elk
card.ability: {G}, Sacrifice Dawntreader Elk: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: #_Silent as winter snow, it seeks wild places unspoiled by the walking dead._#

card.name: Deadly Allure
card.ability: Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn and must be blocked this turn if able.£Flashback {G} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#
card.flavor: #_What could be more irresistible than death?_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : If the target creature is attacking, the defending player must assign at least one blocker to it during the declare blockers step if that player controls any creatures that could block it.

card.name: Death's Caress
card.ability: Destroy target creature. If that creature was a Human, you gain life equal to its toughness.
card.flavor: #_The faint smell of cloves, the rustling of the wind, and a paralyzing descent into an airless, fathomless tomb._#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Check the creature as it last existed on the battlefield to determine if it was a Human. If it was, use its toughness as it last existed on the battlefield to determine how much life is gained. £1/22/2011 : If the target creature isn't on the battlefield or is otherwise an illegal target when Death's Caress tries to resolve, Death's Caress is countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain any life. £7/1/2013 : If Death's Caress resolves but the target creature isn't destroyed, perhaps because it has indestructible or it regenerated, you still check if it's a Human. If so, you'll gain life equal to its toughness.

card.name: Deranged Outcast
card.ability: {1}{G}, Sacrifice a Human: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature.
card.flavor: #_Cast out by his village, he now takes grim offense at refugees who seek shelter in his forest._#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : You can sacrifice any Human you control, including Deranged Outcast itself. £1/22/2011 : Because targets are chosen before costs are paid, you can activate Deranged Outcast's ability targeting itself and then sacrifice Deranged Outcast to pay the cost.

card.name: Diregraf Captain
card.ability: Deathtouch£Other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1.£Whenever another Zombie you control dies, target opponent loses 1 life.
card.flavor: #_Though its mind has long since rotted away, it wields a sword with deadly skill._#

card.name: Divination
card.ability: Draw two cards.
card.flavor: #_Even the House of Galan, who takes the most scholarly approach to the mystic traditions, has resorted to exploring more primitive methods in Avacyn's absence._#

card.name: Drogskol Captain
card.ability: Flying£Other Spirit creatures you control get +1/+1 and have hexproof. #_(They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)_#
card.flavor: #_Dead or alive, true leaders can inspire an entire army._#

card.name: Drogskol Reaver
card.ability: Flying, double strike, lifelink£Whenever you gain life, draw a card.
card.flavor: #_Wracked and warped with anguish, it obsessively seeks out other souls to hoard within its eternal prison._#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : If Drogskol Reaver deals enough first-strike damage to destroy each creature it's blocking or was blocked by, it won't deal any damage during the regular combat damage step (unless it's attacking and somehow gains trample). Its ability won't trigger a second time that combat. £1/22/2011 : The ability triggers just once for each life-gaining event, no matter how much life was gained. £1/22/2011 : If multiple creatures with lifelink you control deal combat damage at the same time, the damage dealt by each of those creatures is a separate life-gaining event and Drogskol Reaver's ability will trigger that many times. £1/22/2011 : If a creature with lifelink you control deals damage to multiple creatures, players, and/or planeswalkers at the same time, the ability will trigger just once. The damage dealt by that creature is a single life-gaining event.
card.name_JP: ドラグスコルの肉裂き

card.name: Dungeon Geists
card.ability: Flying£When Dungeon Geists enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as you control Dungeon Geists.
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : If another player gains control of Dungeon Geists, the creature will no longer be affected by the ability preventing it from untapping, even if you later regain control of Dungeon Geists. £1/22/2011 : If you gain control of the creature that's being prevented from untapping, that creature won't untap during your untap step for as long as you control Dungeon Geists. £4/15/2013 : The ability can target a tapped creature. If the targeted creature is already tapped when it resolves, that creature just remains tapped and doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

card.name: Elbrus, the Binding Blade
card.ability: Equipped creature gets +1/+0.£When equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, unattach Elbrus, the Binding Blade, then transform it.£Equip {1}

card.name: Elgaud Inquisitor
card.ability: Lifelink #_(Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)_#£When Elgaud Inquisitor dies, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: #_"It will take more than steel alone to purge this world of evil."_#

card.name: Erdwal Ripper
card.ability: Haste£Whenever Erdwal Ripper deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor: #_Savage vampires lurk in the Erdwal's network of passageways where prey is plentiful and easy to catch._#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : The +1/+1 counter isn't put on the creature in time to increase the amount of combat damage dealt during that combat step. £1/22/2011 : If this creature deals combat damage to multiple players simultaneously, perhaps because some combat damage was redirected, its ability will trigger for each of those players.
card.name_JP: エルドワルの切り裂き魔

card.name: Evolving Wilds
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: #_"Our world is vast, but Thraben is its heart. The cathedral must stand even if the hinterlands are lost."_#£#_—Thalia, Knight-Cathar_#

card.name: Executioner's Hood
card.ability: Equipped creature has intimidate. #_(This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)_#£Equip {2} #_({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)_#

card.name: Faithless Looting
card.ability: Draw two cards, then discard two cards.£Flashback {2}{R} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#
card.flavor: #_"Avacyn has abandoned us! We have nothing left except what we can take!"_#

card.name: Faith's Shield
card.ability: Target permanent you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.£#_Fateful hour_# — If you have 5 or less life, instead you and each permanent you control gain protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Faith's Shield targets a permanent regardless of how much life you have. If that permanent is an illegal target when Faith's Shield tries to resolve, Faith's Shield will be countered and none of its effects will happen. Neither you nor any of your permanents will gain protection from a color. £1/22/2011 : You choose only one color (not one color per player and permanent). You choose the color as Faith's Shield resolves. £1/22/2011 : A player with protection from a color can't be damaged, enchanted (including by Curses), or targeted by anything of that color.

card.name: Falkenrath Aristocrat
card.ability: Flying, haste£Sacrifice a creature: Falkenrath Aristocrat gains indestructible until end of turn. If the sacrificed creature was a Human, put a +1/+1 counter on Falkenrath Aristocrat.
card.flavor: #_"Your blood is quite pleasing. A pity there's not enough for both of us."_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : The ability checks whether the sacrificed creature as it last existed on the battlefield was a Human. (It doesn't matter what its creature types are in the graveyard.) £1/22/2011 : You can sacrifice Falkenrath Aristocrat itself to activate its ability.
card.name_JP: ファルケンラスの貴種

card.name: Falkenrath Torturer
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Falkenrath Torturer gains flying until end of turn. If the sacrificed creature was a Human, put a +1/+1 counter on Falkenrath Torturer.
card.flavor: #_"There was a time when our cages rang with wailing. Now only a handful of these whimpering fools remain."_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : The ability checks whether the sacrificed creature as it last existed on the battlefield was a Human. (It doesn't matter what its creature types are in the graveyard.) £1/22/2011 : You can sacrifice Falkenrath Torturer itself to activate its ability.
card.name_JP: ファルケンラスの拷問者

card.name: Farbog Boneflinger
card.ability: When Farbog Boneflinger enters the battlefield, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"Here are some bones for you to choke on, dear brother!"_#£#_—Gisa, to Geralf_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Farbog Boneflinger's ability is mandatory. If it's the only creature on the battlefield, you must choose it as the target and give it -2/-2 until end of turn.

card.name: Favor of the Woods
card.ability: Enchant creature£Whenever enchanted creature blocks, you gain 3 life.
card.flavor: #_Feeling abandoned by Avacyn, some Kessigers turned to the pagan rituals of their ancestors._#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : The ability will trigger only once per combat, even if the enchanted creature somehow blocks multiple attacking creatures.

card.name: Feed the Pack
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, you may sacrifice a nontoken creature. If you do, put X 2/2 green Wolf creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is the sacrificed creature's toughness.
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : You choose whether to sacrifice a nontoken creature and which creature to sacrifice when Feed the Pack's ability resolves. £1/22/2011 : Check the sacrificed creature's toughness as it last existed on the battlefield to determine how many Wolves you put onto the battlefield.

card.name: Fiend of the Shadows
card.ability: Flying£Whenever Fiend of the Shadows deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles a card from his or her hand. You may play that card for as long as it remains exiled.£Sacrifice a Human: Regenerate Fiend of the Shadows.
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Playing a card exiled with Fiend of the Shadows follows all the normal rules for playing that card. You must pay its costs, and you must follow all timing restrictions, for example. £1/22/2011 : You may only play the card, meaning play it as a land or cast it as a spell. It's not in your hand. You can't discard it, activate its cycling abilities, and so on. £1/22/2011 : As long as the card remains exiled, you may still play it, even if Fiend of the Shadows leaves the battlefield or changes controllers. £1/22/2011 : If this creature deals combat damage to multiple players simultaneously, perhaps because some combat damage was redirected, its ability will trigger for each of those players.

card.name: Fires of Undeath
card.ability: Fires of Undeath deals 2 damage to target creature or player.£Flashback {5}{B} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#
card.flavor: #_"I drink of those who are worthy of my palate. The rest I burn."_#

card.name: Flayer of the Hatebound
card.ability: Undying #_(When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)_#£Whenever Flayer of the Hatebound or another creature enters the battlefield from your graveyard, that creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Flayer of the Hatebound's last ability will trigger even if a creature enters the battlefield from your graveyard under another player's control. £1/22/2011 : The creature that entered the battlefield from your graveyard deals damage equal to its current power (including any +1/+1 counters it entered the battlefield with) to the target creature or player. If it's no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, its last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its power. £1/22/2011 : Flayer of the Hatebound is the source of the ability, but it may be another creature that is the source of the damage. If a black creature enters the battlefield from your graveyard, the ability could target a creature with protection from black, although the damage will be prevented. It couldn't target a creature with protection from red. £1/22/2011 : Since damage is dealt by the creature, abilities like lifelink and deathtouch are taken into account, even if the creature has left the battlefield by the time it deals damage. £1/22/2011 : If you cast a creature card from your graveyard, that card will be put on the stack before entering the battlefield. Flayer of the Hatebound won't trigger.

card.name: Fling
card.ability: As an additional cost to cast Fling, sacrifice a creature.£Fling deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.
card.flavor: #_Masters of the sword know the blade is not the only weapon at their disposal._#
card.ruling: £8/15/2010 : The sacrificed creature's last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its power. £8/15/2010 : If you sacrifice an attacking or blocking creature during the declare blockers step, it won't deal combat damage. If you wait until the combat damage step, but that creature is dealt lethal damage, it'll be destroyed before you get a chance to sacrifice it. £4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures. £4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Forge Devil
card.ability: When Forge Devil enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to you.
card.flavor: #_Devils infiltrated the lower levels of Thraben Cathedral, making cracks in load-bearing pillars and setting fire to precious archives._#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Forge Devil's ability is mandatory. If it's the only creature on the battlefield, you'll have to choose it as the target and have it deal 1 damage to itself and 1 damage to you.

card.name: Gather the Townsfolk
card.ability: Put two 1/1 white Human creature tokens onto the battlefield.£#_Fateful hour_# — If you have 5 or less life, put five of those tokens onto the battlefield instead.
card.flavor: #_In the memories of those they lost lies the strength needed to defend their city._#

card.name: Gavony Ironwright
card.ability: #_Fateful hour_# — As long as you have 5 or less life, other creatures you control get +1/+4.
card.flavor: #_"I wish my work could shelter everyone, yet I pray we are never so few that it does."_#

card.name: Geralf's Messenger
card.ability: Geralf's Messenger enters the battlefield tapped.£When Geralf's Messenger enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life.£Undying #_(When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)_#

card.name: Geralf's Mindcrusher
card.ability: When Geralf's Mindcrusher enters the battlefield, target player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.£Undying #_(When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)_#

card.name: Ghastly Haunting
card.ability: Enchant creature£You control enchanted creature.

card.name: Ghoultree
card.ability: Ghoultree costs {1} less to cast for each creature card in your graveyard.
card.flavor: #_It uproots entire fengrafs to add to its twisted frame._#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Ghoultree's ability can't reduce the total cost to cast the spell below {G}. £1/22/2011 : Although players may respond to Ghoultree once it's been cast, once it's announced, they can't respond before the cost is calculated and paid.

card.name: Grafdigger's Cage
card.ability: Creature cards can't enter the battlefield from graveyards or libraries.£Players can't cast cards in graveyards or libraries.
card.flavor: #_"If you wind up in one of mine, you can be sure as silver it will be your last."_#£#_—Grafdigger Wulmer_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : If a creature card tries to enter the battlefield from a graveyard or library, it stays in its current zone. £4/15/2013 : The first ability checks only whether the card is a creature card in the graveyard or library. A card such as Sculpting Steel can still enter the battlefield from a graveyard or library as a copy of a creature. £4/15/2013 : The second ability doesn't stop players from playing land cards from graveyards or libraries since lands aren't cast.

card.name: Gravecrawler
card.ability: Gravecrawler can't block.£You may cast Gravecrawler from your graveyard as long as you control a Zombie.
card.flavor: #_"Innistrad's ghoulcallers are talented enough, but let me show you what someone with real power can create."_#£#_—Liliana Vess_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Gravecrawler's ability doesn't change when you could cast it. £1/22/2011 : Once you've cast Gravecrawler and it's on the stack, it doesn't matter if you lose control of the other Zombie.

card.name: Gravepurge
card.ability: Put any number of target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.£Draw a card.
card.flavor: #_"The Blessed Sleep? Ha! Wake up my lovelies, there's work to be done!"_#£#_—Gisa, ghoulcaller of Gavony_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : You choose the order of the cards you put on top of your library. £1/22/2011 : You can cast Gravepurge with zero targets. If you do, you'll draw a card as the spell resolves. £1/22/2011 : If you cast Gravepurge with at least one target and all of those targets become illegal, the spell will be countered and you won't get to draw a card.

card.name: Gravetiller Wurm
card.ability: Trample£#_Morbid_# — Gravetiller Wurm enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.
card.flavor: #_As the creatures of the night closed in on humanity, Innistrad's primeval forces stirred, as though waking to watch the slaughter._#

card.name: Grim Backwoods
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.£{2}{B}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.
card.flavor: #_"I love what they've done with the place."_#£#_—Liliana Vess_#

card.name: Grim Flowering
card.ability: Draw a card for each creature card in your graveyard.
card.flavor: #_"Nothing in nature goes to waste, not even the rotting corpse of a good-for-nothing, blood-sucking vampire."_#£#_—Halana of Ulvenwald_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Count the number of creature cards in your graveyard when Grim Flowering resolves.

card.name: Griptide
card.ability: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
card.flavor: #_"Beware the seagrafs just off the shore. These waters are filled with hungry geists looking for an easy meal."_#£#_—Captain Eberhart_#

card.name: Gruesome Discovery
card.ability: Target player discards two cards.£#_Morbid_# — If a creature died this turn, instead that player reveals his or her hand, you choose two cards from it, then that player discards those cards.

card.name: Harrowing Journey
card.ability: Target player draws three cards and loses 3 life.
card.flavor: #_"There are always fools who attempt to traverse Kruin Pass before sundown and every time they wind up in a race for their lives."_#£#_—Old Rutstein_#

card.name: Haunted Fengraf
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.£{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Haunted Fengraf: Return a creature card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: #_A ghoulcaller's playground._#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : The creature card returned to your hand is chosen at random as the ability resolves. If any player responds to the ability, that player won't yet know what card will be returned. £1/22/2011 : Because the ability doesn't target any creature card, any creature card put into the graveyard in response to that ability may be returned to your hand.

card.name: Havengul Lich
card.ability: {1}: You may cast target creature card in a graveyard this turn. When you cast that card this turn, Havengul Lich gains all activated abilities of that card until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_Fusing intelligence with the power of undeath requires inspiration of the darkest kind._#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Havengul Lich's activated ability creates a delayed triggered ability that triggers when you cast the creature card. This triggered ability will go on the stack on top of the creature spell and will resolve before the creature spell will. £1/22/2011 : If you don't cast the creature card that turn, Havengul Lich won't gain any of its abilities. £1/22/2011 : Havengul Lich gains the activated abilities of the card while that card is still a spell on the stack. £4/15/2013 : Havengul Lich's ability changes the zone you are permitted to cast the card from, not the times you are permitted to cast it. You can cast a creature card that has been targeted by Havengul Lich from the graveyard, but unless it has flash, you can only do so if it's your main phase, the stack is empty, and you have priority. £7/1/2013 : Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities; they have colons in their reminder text.

card.name: Havengul Runebinder
card.ability: {2}{U}, {T}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield, then put a +1/+1 counter on each Zombie creature you control.
card.flavor: #_"So many corpses, so little time."_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Although players may respond to the activated ability, they can't respond to the paying of its costs. The creature card will already be exiled by the time any player could respond. £1/22/2011 : The Zombie creature token you put onto the battlefield will also get a +1/+1 counter.
card.name_JP: ヘイヴングルのルーン縛り

card.name: Headless Skaab
card.ability: As an additional cost to cast Headless Skaab, exile a creature card from your graveyard.£Headless Skaab enters the battlefield tapped.
card.flavor: #_A head is a needless encumbrance when muscle is all that's required._#

card.name: Heavy Mattock
card.ability: Equipped creature gets +1/+1.£As long as equipped creature is a Human, it gets an additional +1/+1.£Equip {2} #_({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)_#

card.name: Heckling Fiends
card.ability: {2}{R}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.
card.flavor: #_Their language may be a cacophonous agglomeration of chittering snorts and mad barking, but the message they send is all too clear._#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : The creature's controller still decides which player or planeswalker the creature attacks. £1/22/2011 : If, during a player's declare attackers step, a creature is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or hasn't been under that player's control continuously since the turn began (and doesn't have haste), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having a creature attack, the player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

card.name: Hellrider
card.ability: Haste£Whenever a creature you control attacks, Hellrider deals 1 damage to defending player.
card.flavor: #_"Behind every devil's mayhem lurks a demon's scheme."_#£#_—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : This damage is not combat damage and may be redirected to a planeswalker controlled by the defending player. £1/22/2011 : If a creature you control attacks a planeswalker, the defending player is the controller of that planeswalker. £1/22/2011 : In some multiplayer variants, creatures you control may attack multiple players and/or planeswalkers. For each attacking creature, Hellrider will deal damage to the corresponding defending player.

card.name: Helvault
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Exile target creature you control.£{7}, {T}: Exile target creature you don't control.£When Helvault is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return all cards exiled with it to the battlefield under their owners' control.
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Helvault's first and third abilities are linked. Similarly, Helvault's second and third abilities are linked. Only cards exiled as a result of Helvault's first or second abilities will be returned to the battlefield by its third ability.

card.name: Highborn Ghoul
card.ability: Intimidate #_(This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)_#
card.flavor: #_"All the dead sleep lightly here, no matter how refined their beds may be."_#£#_—Grafdigger Wulmer_#

card.name: Hinterland Hermit
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Hinterland Hermit.

card.name: Hinterland Scourge
card.ability: Hinterland Scourge must be blocked if able.£At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Hinterland Scourge.

card.name: Hollowhenge Beast
card.flavor: #_In a world of monsters, it's the stuff of nightmares._#

card.name: Hollowhenge Spirit
card.ability: Flash #_(You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)_#£Flying£When Hollowhenge Spirit enters the battlefield, remove target attacking or blocking creature from combat.
card.flavor: #_Some spirits mourn. Others terrorize._#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Removing an attacking creature from combat doesn't untap that creature. £1/22/2011 : Removing a blocking creature from combat doesn't cause the creature it was blocking to become unblocked. If no other creatures are blocking that attacking creature, it won't assign combat damage (unless it has trample). £1/22/2011 : If there are multiple combat phases in a turn, a creature that's been removed from combat can still attack or block in future combat steps that turn.

card.name: Hunger of the Howlpack
card.ability: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.£#_Morbid_# — Put three +1/+1 counters on that creature instead if a creature died this turn.
card.flavor: #_"Werewolves are an unholy mix of a predator's instinct and a human's hatred."_#£#_—Alena, trapper of Kessig_#

card.name: Huntmaster of the Fells
card.ability: Whenever this creature enters the battlefield or transforms into Huntmaster of the Fells, put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield and you gain 2 life.£At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Huntmaster of the Fells.
card.name_ES: Maestro de caza de las colinas

card.name: Immerwolf
card.ability: Intimidate #_(This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)_#£Each other creature you control that's a Wolf or a Werewolf gets +1/+1.£Non-Human Werewolves you control can't transform.
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : A creature that's both a Wolf and a Werewolf gets the bonus only once. £1/22/2011 : Immerwolf's bonus never applies to itself, even if it somehow becomes a Werewolf creature. £1/22/2011 : A "non-Human Werewolf" is a creature that is a Werewolf but is not a Human.

card.name: Increasing Ambition
card.ability: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. If Increasing Ambition was cast from a graveyard, instead search your library for two cards and put those cards into your hand. Then shuffle your library.£Flashback {7}{B} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#

card.name: Increasing Confusion
card.ability: Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If Increasing Confusion was cast from a graveyard, that player puts twice that many cards into his or her graveyard instead.£Flashback {X}{U} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Regardless of which zone Increasing Confusion is cast from, it puts cards from the top of target player's library into that player's graveyard.

card.name: Increasing Devotion
card.ability: Put five 1/1 white Human creature tokens onto the battlefield. If Increasing Devotion was cast from a graveyard, put ten of those tokens onto the battlefield instead.£Flashback {7}{W}{W} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#

card.name: Increasing Savagery
card.ability: Put five +1/+1 counters on target creature. If Increasing Savagery was cast from a graveyard, put ten +1/+1 counters on that creature instead.£Flashback {5}{G}{G} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#

card.name: Increasing Vengeance
card.ability: Copy target instant or sorcery spell you control. If Increasing Vengeance was cast from a graveyard, copy that spell twice instead. You may choose new targets for the copies.£Flashback {3}{R}{R} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Increasing Vengeance can target (and copy) any instant or sorcery spell you control, not just one with targets. £1/22/2011 : When Increasing Vengeance resolves, it creates one or two copies of a spell. You control each of the copies. Those copies are created on the stack, so they're not "cast." Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger. The copies will then resolve like normal spells, after players get a chance to cast spells and activate abilities. £1/22/2011 : Each of the copies will have the same targets as the spell it's copying unless you choose new ones. You may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, you can't choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal). If there are two copies, you may change the targets of each of them to different legal targets. £1/22/2011 : If the spell Increasing Vengeance copies is modal (that is, it says "Choose one --" or the like), the copies will have the same mode(s). You can't choose different ones. £1/22/2011 : If the spell Increasing Vengeance copies has an X whose value was determined as it was cast (like Earthquake does), the copy has the same value of X. £1/22/2011 : You can't choose to pay any additional costs for the copies. However, effects based on any additional costs that were paid for the original spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copies too. For example, if you sacrifice a 3/3 creature to cast Fling and then copy it with Increasing Vengeance, the copies of Fling will also deal 3 damage to its target.

card.name: Jar of Eyeballs
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control dies, put two eyeball counters on Jar of Eyeballs.£{3}, {T}, Remove all eyeball counters from Jar of Eyeballs: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of eyeball counters removed this way. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

card.name: Kessig Recluse
card.ability: Reach #_(This creature can block creatures with flying.)_#£Deathtouch #_(Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)_#
card.flavor: #_Its silk is highly prized, but then again, so is your life._#

card.name: Krallenhorde Killer
card.ability: {3}{G}: Krallenhorde Killer gets +4/+4 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.£At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Krallenhorde Killer.

card.name: Lambholt Elder
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Lambholt Elder.

card.name: Lingering Souls
card.ability: Put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.£Flashback {1}{B} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#
card.flavor: #_The murdered inhabitants of Hollowhenge impart to the living the terror they felt in death._#

card.name: Lost in the Woods
card.ability: Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Forest card, remove that creature from combat. Then put the revealed card on the bottom of your library.
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Removing an attacking creature from combat doesn't untap that creature. £1/22/2011 : Because Lost in the Woods will trigger once for each creature that attacks you or a planeswalker you control, it's important to specify which trigger is associated with which attacking creature before revealing any cards.

card.name: Loyal Cathar
card.ability: Vigilance£When Loyal Cathar dies, return it to the battlefield transformed under your control at the beginning of the next end step.

card.name: Markov Blademaster
card.ability: Double strike£Whenever Markov Blademaster deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor: #_"Mortals practice swordplay for a few decades at best. How can they ever attain the exquisite mastery that eternity has to offer?"_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : The +1/+1 counter isn't put on Markov Blademaster in time to increase the amount of combat damage dealt during that combat step. However, the +1/+1 counter put on Markov Blademaster when first-strike damage is dealt will increase the amount of damage dealt during the regular combat damage step. £1/22/2011 : If this creature deals combat damage to multiple players simultaneously, perhaps because some combat damage was redirected, its ability will trigger for each of those players.

card.name: Markov Warlord
card.ability: Haste£When Markov Warlord enters the battlefield, up to two target creatures can't block this turn.
card.flavor: #_"What use is a stake or holy symbol in the hands of a coward?"_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : You may target zero, one, or two creatures with Markov Warlord's enters-the-battlefield triggered ability. £1/22/2011 : The creatures can't block any creatures that turn, not just Markov Warlord.

card.name: Midnight Guard
card.ability: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, untap Midnight Guard.
card.flavor: #_"When you're on watch, no noise is harmless and no shadow can be ignored."_#£#_—Olgard of the Skiltfolk_#

card.name: Mikaeus, the Unhallowed
card.ability: Intimidate£Whenever a Human deals damage to you, destroy it.£Other non-Human creatures you control get +1/+1 and have undying. #_(When a creature with undying dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)_#
card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Noncombat damage dealt to you by a Human and damage dealt to you by a Human you control will also cause Mikaeus's triggered ability to trigger. £1/22/2011 : The +1/+1 bonus that Mikaeus gives to other non-Human creatures is not a counter and won't prevent the undying ability from working. £1/22/2011 : Mikaeus, the Unhallowed and the Innistrad set's Mikaeus, the Lunarch can be on the battlefield at the same time. The "legend rule" applies only to legendary permanents that have exactly the same name.

card.name: Mondronen Shaman
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Mondronen Shaman.

card.name: Moonscarred Werewolf
card.ability: Vigilance£{T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.£At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Moonscarred Werewolf.

card.ability: Flying£{R}: Each creature you control gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"Their hearts beat, their lungs draw breath, and they have one true form. I count them as allies of the living."_#£#_—Thalia, Knight-Cathar_#

card.name: Mystic Retrieval

card.ruling: £1/22/2011 : Mystic Retrieval can't target itself. It's on the stack when you choose its target.
